channel.description: Recent content in The Property Academy Podcast on SWIEST - Transcripts · Screenplays · Lyrics

item.title: Mortgage Jargon Explained – What Banks + Brokers Really Mean ⎜ Ep. 1559 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by April Hastilow from Opes Mortgages to discuss what banks and brokers mean when they use jardon. This includes a discussion of split banking, LVR, DTI and all those niggly terms that first timers may not understand but are too scared to ask about. Transcript

item.title: The 5 Levels of Decision Making – 5 Ways to Make a Property Investment Decision ⎜ Ep. 1558 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the 5 levels of decision making. These are the 5 ways you can make a decision about how you invest in property. The levels include guessing and emotions, anecdotes and experience, basic data, and advanced probabilities. You can check out the diagram showing the 5 levels of decision making here. We also mentioned Ed's latest oneroof article, and our 'How long does it take to find a tenant' article.

item.title: Case Study Sunday: "It Hasn't Worked Out For Me" – with David Melse ⎜ Ep. 1557 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by David Melse. He talks us through all the property investment strategies he's tried in the past and how it hasn't worked out for him. That includes where he's invested, how long he's held on for, and what his next step is. Transcript

item.title: Guaranteed Returns? – If I Buy a Property with Property Coach ... What's the Guarantee it Works? ⎜ Ep. 1556 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss property coach guarantees. This is about what happens if you buy a property through a property coach or property investment company and things go wrong. For this, we are joined by Vanessa Garrod from Opes Mortgages to talk about how to make a complaint and make sure your property coach does the right thing. Transcript

item.title: Bright Line Test Changes Revealed – How It Impacts The Property Market ⎜ Ep. 1555 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the details of the bright line test. This includes when National plans to bring it in, how many properties will be impacted, and what it means for housing supply. We also work through examples to show you how much tax you could save. Transcript

item.title: Are All Developer Cashbacks Dodgy? 3 Things That Need to Be True ⎜ Ep. 1554 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether all cashbacks from developers are dodgy. This includes an analysis of other developer incentives like rental guarantees. We give you three tests you can run your developer incentive through to see whether it's clean, or whether you should run a country mile. Transcript

item.title: Bonus: Top 5 New Policies That Property Investors Need to Know - Webinar audio | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this special bonus episode, you'll hear the audio from the recent Property Live webinar where we looked at 'Top 5 New Policies That Property Investors Need to Know'. Transcript

item.title: 7 Alternative Christmas Gifts For Property Investors ⎜ Ep. 1553 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss 7 alternative Christmas gifts for property investors. These aren't the standard gifts people buy for each other at Christmas. But for that property investor (or future property investor) in your life they could do just the trick. Transcript

item.title: How To Save (A Lot) of Money with Stacey Adams ⎜ Ep. 1552 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by Stacey Adams to talk about how she manages to save a lot of money through her savings system. This includes where to start and how to go form saving 10% of your income up to 40%. This includes when to share and merge your finances with your partner and how to make sure you take control of your money. Transcript

item.title: Don't Listen To These People – Where To Get Your Property Advice From? ⎜ Ep. 1551 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss who you should and shouldn't get your property investment advice from. This includes who to talk to about which parts of the property investment journey and a look at the Dunning-Kruger effect. Ultimately this will help you better navigate the world of property investment. Transcript

item.title: Case Study Sunday: "The Mortgage Broker Said No – Bought a House Anyway" with Stacey and Matt ⎜ Ep. 1550 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by Stacey and Matt for Case Study Sunday. They share their journey in property investment, including how their mortgage broker initially said they couldn't invest. Then they talked to someone else ... and got the money to invest anyway. Transcript

item.title: How To Invest As a Single Person (On One Income) ⎜ Ep. 1549 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how to invest as a single person on one income. This includes the unique challenges of investing when you're single. The pros and cons and how to manage it. Ultimately this is to help you figure out if it's possible to invest on your own. Transcript

item.title: How Much Passive Income Should I Aim For? ⎜ Ep. 1548 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how much passive income you should aim for when creating a property investment plan. This is important, because this is the #1 question property investors come up against when they start creating a long term plan ... "What should I aim for." So we walk you through the 6 different lifestyles you could aim for with what you can spend in each scenario.

item.title: Inflation Coming Down? OCR Update & Reserve Bank Revises House Price Forecast ⎜ Ep. 1547 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we dive into the latest monetary policy statement from the Reserve Bank. We go through their house price and inflation predictions, as well as what they say (vs what they potentially mean). This is to give you a sense of what the interest rates could be next year. Transcript

item.title: How Much Should I Save? Actual Numbers Revealed ⎜ Ep. 1546 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how to figure out the amount your should be saving. There is no rule (or number) that suits everyone. But, most financial commentators and books suggest 20% of your take home pay. This works as a ballpark, hard-and-fast rule to get a sense of whether you are over or under saving/investing. Transcript

item.title: Auckland vs Hamilton: Where is the best place to invest? ⎜ Ep. 1545 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the pros and cons of investing in Hamilton and Auckland. That includes whether it's better to invest in the larger city (Auckland), or go for the more affordable option (Hamilton). Ultimately we share the facts then take a step back so you can decide which is the right place to invest for you. Transcript

item.title: How to Make an Extra $1 million in Property – Does Our Over/Under Model Actually Work? ⎜ Ep. 1544 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether the overvalued-undervalued model we talk about on this show actually works. We walk you through 20 years of investing in property to discuss what would happen if you followed this shows advice. We talk about the sort of properties you'd buy, where you'd buy and how much money you would have made compared to buying the average porperty. Transcript

item.title: Case Study Sunday – We Bought 6 Properties in 4 years. How James Did It ⎜ Ep. 1543 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by James who shares how he bought 6 properties in just 4 years. He and his wife now own 8 properties in total. He talks about how he grew his portfolio while earning a normal income. This includes how he got the money to invest, where he invested, and how this show helped him on the way. Transcript

item.title: "Tenants Can Have Pets" Tenancy Tribunal Says – Can I Still Stop My Tenants Having Pets? ⎜ Ep. 1542 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether you can still stop your tenants from having pets in your rental property. New Tenancy Tribunal decisions suggest that property investors have to let tenants have pets. We go through the details to show what these decisions mean and how you can still protect yourself as an investor. Transcript

item.title: Tenancy Tribunal – Top Reasons Your Tenant Takes You to The Tribunal ⎜ Ep. 1541 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the top reasons that tenants take property investors to the tenancy tribunal. This includes how often you could find yourself at the tribunal and how to manage it. That way you can get a sense of how often you might find yourself in trouble and the reasons why. Transcript

item.title: New Government. New Policies. What the Media Missed ⎜ Ep. 1540 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the new government policies about what they mean for property investors. This is a first look after National, Act and New Zealand First released their respective coalition agreements. There are opportunities for property investors in these new policies. So we go through what you need to know. Transcript

item.title: Negotiation No No's For New Builds ... Niggly Things Developer's Funders Want | Ep. 1539 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by Sue Foley from Landley Law to talk about negotiation no, no's for new builds. This includes the niggly things that developers funders and financiers require them to have in contracts. Ultimately this will help you be more informed when you negotiate an off-the-plans contract with a developer. Transcript

item.title: Sunset Clauses – What Property Investors Need to Know in 2024 with Sue Foley | Ep. 1538 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by Sue Foley from Landley Law to discuss what property investors need to know about sunset clauses in 2024. This includes how to negotiate a sunset clause, why they're needed at all, and how to make sure you don't get screwed over by a developer. Transcript

item.title: Your Options When You Retire With a House and Nothing Else – Case Study | Ep. 1537 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss a case study of a listener of the show. His parents are about to retire and they want to build a passive income. Right now they have a mortgage free house, but not much else. We talk through their options and how they could build a small passive income by downsizing their home. Transcript

item.title: Case Study Sunday: Buying Property in a Group – How Lochie Did It | Ep. 1536 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by Lochie Mckellar who shares how he bought his first investment property with 5 friends. He takes us through what he bought, how the mortgage worked and how he convinced his friends to go in with him. Ultimately this will be useful for any investors who are interested in buying property as part of a syndicate or group. Transcript

item.title: Homeowner Loses $405,000 – People Who Lost Money in Property | Ep. 1535 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss Kiwis who lost money in property. One homeowner lost over $400,000 in just 2 years. This shows that while people can make money in property, there are some people who lose a lot of money. This is based on CoreLogic's Pain and Gain Report. Transcript

item.title: Data Day – Property Market Update – What's Happening to NZ House Prices? | Ep. 1534 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the most recent data about the NZ property market. We look at where house prices are increasing and decreasing, and where property prices have rebounded first. Transcript

item.title: ANZ vs ASB vs BNZ vs Westpac – Aren't All Banks the Same? | Ep. 1533 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by April Hastilow from Opes Mortgages to compare the banks' lending policies. This includes who each bank may be a good fit for ... and who might struggle a little more to get lending. Ultimately this is to demonstrate how each bank will look at your mortgage application in a different way. That way you can make an informed choice about where you get your lending from.

item.title: 12 Predictions and Forecasts For 2024 – What Will Happen in Property Investment? | Ep. 1532 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss 12 predictions and forecasts for what could happen in property investment in 2024. This includes what could happen to house prices, interest rates and inflation. We also chuck in a few odd-ball forecasts about what could happen to KiwiBuild and developers during the new year. Transcript

item.title: How Do I Keep Buying Property When the Banks Won't Lend Me More Money? | Ep. 1531 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how to keep buying properties when the banks won't lend you more money. We give you the tactics you can use to improve your servicing, so you can still get a mortgage. You'll also learn what strategies to take to get more money from different lenders. And while there are some tactics you can use to keep growing your portfolio ... sometimes it does come down to waiting.

item.title: Investor vs Homeowner Mindset – Which Are You Thinking Like? | Ep. 1530 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the differences between having an investor and homeowner mindset when investing in property. This includes looking at the things that homeowners care about when purchasing properties. We then look at whether these factors really matter when you're purchasing an investment property. Transcript

item.title: Case Study Sunday: How to Become a Property Developer with George Clifford | Ep. 1529 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by George Clifford, a property developer from Four Avenues. George shares how he became a property developer, the highs and the lows, and how it all works. This includes how much money you need to get started and what he did to get his start. That way you can learn how to become a property developer too. Transcript

item.title: New Builds vs Existing [Update] – What's Better After the Tax Changes? | Ep. 1528 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss New Builds vs existing properties and which is better after the new tax changes come in. This includes a look at deposits, return on investment, which are more expensive, and how the taxes work. And while we here at Opes Partners help investors buy New Builds, we also know that they aren't the right fit for everyone. So outlining the pros and cons means you can then decide which is the right fit for you.

item.title: Upgrade My Own Home vs Investing in Property – Can I Do Both? | Ep. 1527 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether you should invest in property or upgrade your own home ... and whether you can do both. This comes after a listener of the show messaged in asking about their own situation. They want to invest in property, but they also want to upgrade their own home. Can they do both? Transcript

item.title: Is It Still Worth Investing in Property in 2024? | Ep. 1526 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether it is still worth investing in property in 2024. This includes a look at cashflow, capital growth and the potential house price increases in 2024. We also look at the probability that these returns eventuate so you can make an informed decision about whether investing in property is right for you. Transcript

item.title: House Price Predictions – How much will house prices go up in 2024? | Ep. 1525 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how much house prices might go up in 2024. We look at the predictions and forecasts out of Westpac, ASB, BNZ and ANZ and others. Ultimately no one knows how much house prices might change. But this will give you a sense of what could happen. Transcript

item.title: How To Diversify Your Property Portfolio To Spread the Risk and Increase Returns | Ep. 1524 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how to diversify your property portfolio to spread the risk and get higher returns. We compare the Auckland and Gisborne property market and talk about what a diversified portfolio would look like. This includes how to adapt your portfolio so it increases in value more consistently over time. Transcript

item.title: Case Study Sunday – Cashflow Positive Airbnb | Ep. 1522 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by a listener of the show, Shannon, to discuss how she's using Airbnb to make her investment property cashflow positive. This includes where she is investing and what her strategy is. Transcript

item.title: Land Banking – Is It Worth It? | Ep. 1523 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss land banking. This is a property investment strategy where investors buy land and hold it for the long term. But what are the pros and cons of landbanking? And is it still a good strategy in 2024? That's what we cover in this episode. Transcript

item.title: How Easy Is It To Get a Mortgage in 2024? | Ep. 1521 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by Peter Norris from Opes Mortgages to discuss how easy it is to get a mortgage in 2024. This includes a review of the factors that will make it easier and harder to get a mortgage in the new year. That way you can foresee and figure out what you need to think about when applying for a mortgage. Transcript

item.title: The 7 Uncertainties of Property Investment ... What You Can Expect | Ep. 1520 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the 7 uncertainties in property investment. These are the risks and the "you don't know what you don't knows". This includes a breakdown of all the things you can't necessarily control and what to do about them. This way you know what to look out for when you invest in property. Transcript

item.title: 4 Ways To Make Money In Property (The Only 4 ways) | Ep. 1519 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the only 4 ways to make money in real estate. Fresh off our Wealth Plan tour, these include capital growth, instant equity, debt repayments and cashflow. Ultimately you can use this information to evaluate any strategy you're considering. Transcript

item.title: Shares vs Property vs Term Deposits ... The 7 Differences You Can't Ignore | Ep. 1518 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the key differences between shares, property and term deposits. And we go through the 7 differences that you can't ignore. This includes the sort of returns you get, how the returns differ and how easy it is to diversify. Ultimately this allows you to figure out which type of investment is right for you. Transcript

item.title: Revealed: The #1 Most Overused Phrase on TradeMe | Ep. 1517 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the most overused phrases on TradeMe. Ed and Andrew play a game to see if they can guess that most used phrases by real estate agents. They take turns guessing the phrases agents use before adding them up to see who wins. This is a fun game for property investors to see if they can guess the best real estate cliche. Transcript

item.title: Flipping Good App – Tama Singh's New App Reviewed – InvestorPro | Ep. 1516 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we review InvestorPro, an app just released by property investor, Tama Singh. This includes the pros and the cons so you can decide whether this is the right app for you. We also talk about pricing, how much InvestorPro costs and when you'd use it. Transcript

item.title: Case Study Sunday: Buying an Investment With Your Family. How Emily Did It | Ep. 1515 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by Emily for another Case Study Sunday. Emily shares how she bought her first home with her family and how she has used that to buy her first home. Transcript

item.title: Unlucky Letterbox Numbers – Do They Make a Difference? | Ep. 1514 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether unlucky numbers of your letterbox make a difference to your property's value. Some cultures avoid and are superstitious about certain numbers like 4, 13 and 44. But does it make a difference when it comes to your property's value. We dive into the data to find out how you should use these numbers as part of your property investment strategy. Transcript

item.title: When Paying Down Debt Just Makes Sense ⎜ Ep. 1513 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss when paying down debt just makes sense. So often on the show we bang on about interest-only mortgages. But you shouldn't always avoid paying down debt. Sometimes it just makes sense. That's why in this show you'll hear the times and situations when paying down investment debt just makes sense. Main topics discussed: principal and interest vs interest only Transcript

item.title: How Long Will I Live? How Long Does Retirement Last? ⎜ Ep. 1512 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how long you can expect your retirement to last. This is based in Stats NZ data that shows how long the average person is expected to live based on their sex and birthdate. We show how the average person underestimates how long they're expected to live and therefore how much money they'll need for retirement. Main topics discussed: Life expectancy How long the average person lives How long retirement lasts Transcript

item.title: Best Property Software in NZ – Property Guru vs Relab vs MyPropTech ⎜ Ep. 1511 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we compare the top property software in New Zealand. Specifically we look at Property Guru, Relab and MyPropTech. Property Guru is produced by CoreLogic, while Relab is an independent startup. On the other hand MyPropTech is part of the Du Val Group. We weigh up the pros and cons of each software so you can decide which is the right one for you. Main topics discussed: Property Guru, Relab and MyPropTech Top Property Software NZ Transcript

item.title: 7 Things Accountants Are Plain Wrong About ⎜ Ep. 1510 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the 7 things that non-property accountants get wrong when it comes to property. This includes things like "buy a commercial building" and "it's a bad investment". To be clear, you need a good property accountant. But sometimes more general business accountants give bad advice when it comes to property. If you're looking for a good property accountant here are our picks for the top property accountants in New Zealand?

item.title: 4 Strategies to Make Your Retirement Funds Last Longer ⎜ Ep. 1509 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the 4 strategies you can use to make your retirement fund last longer. This is based on the 4 rules of thumb that have been released by the NZ Society of Actuaries. The rules of thumb include: the rule of 6%, the rule of 4% and 2 others. But you'll have to listen to the episode to find out what they are. Main topics discussed:

item.title: Case Study Sunday – "Mortgage Free at 31 and 33" How Troy and Jana Did It ⎜ Ep. 1508 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how Troy and Jana became mortgage free by 31 and 33. They walk us through how they used investment properties to pay off their mortgage, and how they are growing their property portfolio. Main topics discussed: How to use investment properties to pay off your mortgage Opes Partners Customer Case Study Transcript

item.title: Company vs Look-Through-Company? How Should I Own My Investment Properties? ⎜ Ep. 1507 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether you should use a look through company or normal (standard) company to own your investment properties. This includes a discussion about the pros and cons of both ways to owns your investments. On one hand ordinary companies appear to have a lower tax rate, but this isn't always as simple as it seems. Main topics discussed: Look through companies vs companies for investment properties Property accountants Ownership structures Transcript

item.title: 7 Things Your Family Will Say About Property Investors at the Summer BBQ ⎜ Ep. 1506 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the 7 things that your family or Uncle Lester will say about property investment at the family BBQ. Property investment is a contentious topic, especially among family and friends. So this episode is to share what they might say and what to look out for. Transcript

item.title: enable.me vs Opes Partners: What is the difference? An Honest Review ⎜ Ep. 1505 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we give an honest overview of the differences between enable.me and Opes Partners. This includes differences in the price of properties offered through their subsidiary (Momentum Realty) and Opes. We also talk about the costs you need to think about the differences in build type. Ultimately this is so you can decide which is the right option for you. item.title: Fixing Your Credit Score: How to Make Sure Bad Debts Don't Stop You Getting a Mortgage ⎜ Ep. 1504 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how to find out and then fix your credit score. This includes what to do if you find there are factors on your credit report that could stop you from getting a mortgage. Main points discussed: ClearScore Credit scores and credit reports How to find out your credit score And we also mention our upcoming ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠Wealth Plan seminars⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠ in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch. Click the link to register for tickets.

item.title: Top 6 Developers in Christchurch. They're Not Who You Think ⎜ Ep. 1503 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the top 6 property developers in Christchurch. This includes who they are, what they specialise in and why we like them. So if you're interested in buying an investment property you can know who you might like to consider. Top picks include: Oakridge Homes, Freedom Built, Rosefern, Millsford, Four Avenues and Tao Homes. And we also mention our upcoming ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠Wealth Plan seminars⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠ in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch.

item.title: Airbnb Cashflow: What The Cashflow Looks Like on an Airbnb Property ⎜ Ep. 1502 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how to create a cashflow for an AirBnb property. This includes how much it costs to maintain an AirBnb and how much money you can make. We also discuss how much vacancy you should expect to have with a property you're renting out as short term accomodation. This way you can have confidence if you do decide to rent your house out as an AirBnb.

item.title: Case Study Sunday: Producer Dave Proves He's Real and Not Ai ⎜ Ep. 1501 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by Producer Dave, the editor and producer of the Property Academy Podcast. He shares some of the stories from behind the scenes of the show and talks about how he started investing in property. This includes some of his top learnings from being involved in the show. And we also mention our upcoming ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠Wealth Plan seminars⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠ in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch. Click the link to register for tickets.

item.title: Revealed: The Hottest Rental Markets In NZ. No3 Will Surprise You ⎜ Ep. 1500 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode we discuss the hottest and coldest rental markets in New Zealand. This is based on new data from TradeMe that shows the average number of days a property stays listed online. Some of the areas discussed include: Thames-Coromandel, Otorohanga, Kawerau, Queenstown, Blenheim, Southland and Westland. And we also mention our upcoming ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠Wealth Plan seminars⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠ in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch. Click the link to register for tickets.

item.title: No Money Down Deals. Buying a House with No Deposit – Contemporaneous Settlements ⎜ Ep. 1499 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss no money down deals and contemporaneous settlements. This includes how to make money from a no money down deal and the risks it involves. This includes how to negotiate a no money down deal and the levers you can pull like asking for a deferred settlement (delayed settlement) and early access. Main points discussed: Contemporaneous settlements deferred settlement (delayed settlement) Early access No money down deals And we also mention our upcoming ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠Wealth Plan seminars⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠ in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch.

item.title: Warning! Do Not Use a Property Coach Until You Do This ⎜ Ep. 1498 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description in this episode, we discuss what property investors must do before using (and paying for) a property coach. This comes after Andrew met with an investor who had paid $18,000 for property coaching ... but they then found out they couldn't get the money from the bank. They'd forked out thousands for education they wouldn't be able to use. Main topics discussed: Property coaches like Property Apprentice, Wolfe Property Coaching, AssetLab, Property Lifestyle, Nichole Lewis and Wealth Mentor Cost of property coaching And we also mention our upcoming ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠Wealth Plan seminars⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠ in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch.

item.title: National Wins: How a National Government Will Change The Property Market ⎜ Ep. 1497 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the impact of a potential new National-led government on the NZ property market. Will property prices increase faster?
