item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we dive into New Zealand's housing landscape to discuss whether first-home buyers can still break through. We talk about the widening gap between house prices and income growth. But also that despite the challenges, first-home buyers are making homeownership happen, accounting for a quarter of the market. We also explore international homeownership comparisons, debunking some common misconceptions. You'll also hear inspiring stories of first-home buyers overcoming obstacles and offer practical advice for those looking to secure their first property.

item.title: Convincing The Sceptic – How To Get Your Partner On Board With Property Investing ⎜ Ep. 1391 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss a situation where a listener of the show is trying to convince her sceptical husband to invest in property. We share her story and talk through the best way to talk to your significant other about property investment. This includes a discussion about what happens when they read bad news articles in the media. Ultimately we suggest that instead of trying to 'convince the sceptic', you should instead try to understand their thoughts, concerns and fears so you can discuss how to work through them.

item.title: How Many Cars Do Kiwis Actually Own? How Many Car Parks Should My Investment Property Have? ⎜ Ep. 1390 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how many cars Kiwis own. This includes diving into the numbers to look at how car ownership differs between homeowners and tenants. We also discuss how this changes around the country. People own lots of cars in some parts of NZ, and fewer cars in other parts. Ultimately, this will help you make a decision about how many cars you need in your investment property.

item.title: Case Study Sunday – 29 Year Old Buys Her First Investment Property. How Nicole Did It ⎜ Ep. 1389 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by Nicole, a property investor who bought her first rental at 29. Nicole shares how she bought her first home and the steps she took to get ready to invest in property. But it wasn't until Nicole saw someone her age buying an investment property that she realised she could too. As usual, Nicole is a listener of the show and has come on to Case Study Sunday to share her story and inspire others.

item.title: TradeMe vs Realestate.co.nz – What's The Best Website for Finding NZ Properties? ⎜ Ep. 1388 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss which is the better website for finding property investment deals – TradeMe or Realestate.co.nz. We review how many listings each website has, the features and the differences in how you search for properties. Ultimtaely there are more differences than you might think. Ultimately we crown the king of property websites. Transcript

item.title: Where Will Property Prices Bottom Out (And Bounce Back) First? ⎜ Ep. 1387 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we look through the latest property market data to determine which New Zealand areas will bottom out first. This includes a discussion of which areas are still seeing significant price falls and which are seeing little change. Ultimately this will help you make a decision about whether (and where) to invest over the next year or two. Transcript

item.title: It's Not Easy Being Green – Green Party's New Wealth Tax Proposal ⎜ Ep. 1386 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the Green Party's new Wealth Tax policy. We look at how this policy would impact property investors if implemented. This includes how one investor's effective tax rate would rise from 2up to 98%. This gives you the facts so you can make an informed decision about whether to invest and what policies to support in the upcoming election. Transcript

item.title: "We Tried Investing in Student Housing - The Rental Yields Will Shock You!" ⎜ Ep. 1385 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by Ilse Wolfe from Opes Accelerate to discuss what property investors need to know about investing in student housing. We deep dive into the Dunedin market and look at where student housing is most in demand, the types of properties that suit student housing, and the returns investors can get when investing in these types of properties. Ultimately this will help you understand whether investing in student housing is the right fit for you.

item.title: Negative Equity: Have Falling House Prices Put You In Mortgage Prison? ⎜ Ep. 1384 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the concept of 'negative equity'. This includes what it is, who is most likely to fall into having negative equity, and how to get yourself out. We also discuss how being in (or close) to negative equity can put property investors into 'Mortgage Prison'. This is where you struggle to switch banks because your property's value has decreased. This can mean you struggle to get a better interest rate.

item.title: The Secret Language of Real Estate Agents: What They Say Vs What They Mean ⎜ Ep. 1383 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the secret language of real estate agents; this includes the euphemisms they use when advertising properties. We go through words like 'cosy', 'motivated seller', 'shabby chic' and 'renovator's dream'. This shows you what to look for when searching for properties online. Transcript

item.title: Case Study Sunday – Real Investor: How Eliot Started Flipping Properties In Christchurch ⎜ Ep. 1382 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by a listener of the show – Eliot – who shares how he started investing in property and how he has now started flipping properties. He also shares how he found a business partner to start flipping with, how he renovated his first property during the pandemic, and the next steps he'll take in his renovation and property investment journey. If you want to come on the show and share your story, email ed@opespartners.

item.title: NZ vs Australia: The Investing Strategies That Work Across The Ditch (New vs Existing) ⎜ Ep. 1381 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we compare the strategies that work when investing in property in Australia and the New Zealand market. This comes after a listener of the show asked why some property experts in Australia recommend against investing in New Build properties. Whereas others in New Zealand favour investing in New Builds. We compare the different rules in Australia and New Zealand so you can decide how you want to start investing.

item.title: I'm Moving to Australia! What Do I Do With My NZ Properties?" ⎜ Ep. 1380 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss what Kiwis need to know if they move to Australia. This includes what to do with your New Zealand properties and the different options you have. This includes a discussion on how to grow your NZ property investment portfolio before you move across the ditch and how to hang on to your properties in NZ. Transcript

item.title: Property Spruikers' Dirty Secrets: Hidden Commissions and Trickery Revealed ⎜ Ep. 1379 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the dirty secrets of property spruikers. These businesses (primarily based in Australia) sell you bad property investment deals. We share their underhanded tactics to get people to invest and what's wrong with some of their deals. This includes businesses selling properties for more money than they are worth and even mortgage and bank fraud (on the part of the spruikers). Ultimately this episode will help you spot a property spruiker to avoid their high commissions and trickery.

item.title: Bonus - How To Get The Bank To Say Yes ... Two Case Studies on Increasing Serviceability - Webinar audio | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this special bonus episode, you'll hear the audio from the recent Property Live webinar where we looked at 'How To Get The Bank To Say Yes ... Two Case Studies on Increasing Serviceability' with Ilse Wolfe from Opes Accelerate. Transcript

item.title: Bought a House with Your Parents? Brace Yourself for this Hidden Tax ⎜ Ep. 1378 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss a hidden tax that most Kiwis don't think about when buying a house with their parents. We all know about the Bright Line Test. That's New Zealand's version of a capital tax gains tax. And most of us also know it doesn't apply to the family home. But, if your parents buy your house with you, they could have to pay tax if you sell your property within the bright line.

item.title: Are Christchurch Properties Harder to Insure After the Earthquakes? ⎜ Ep. 1377 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether it is harder to insure properties in Christchurch compared to the rest of the country. We go through the data to show which parts of the country are most likely to be hit by an earthquake and also look at how much insurance costs around the country. Ultimately this will let you make an informed decision about where to invest, and you'll also understand how much your house insurance could cost.

item.title: "I Regret Paying Down Debt" – When Paying Off Debt Is The Wrong Decision ⎜ Ep. 1376 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we share a case study of a listener of the show who regrets paying down debt. We share how they sold a property and paid down their personal mortgage. This investor wanted to re-borrow against his home to purchase an investment property. But he decided to wait because it wasn't the right time to buy. When the investor was ready to grow his investment portfolio, his house value had dropped.

item.title: Case Study Sunday: "We Now Earn $52,000 More And Bought Our First Investment Property" ⎜ Ep. 1375 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by property investor and financial adviser Stevie Waring to discuss a case study of a couple who increased their income so they could start investing in property. This couple had a lot of bubblegum debt. That's credit cards, personal loans and car loans. This debt was holding them back from investing in property. So they increased their incomes by a whopping $52,000 so they could invest in property.

item.title: Buying a Property: The Emotional Rollercoaster You Didn't See Coming! ⎜ Ep. 1374 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the emotional rollercoaster of purchasing an investment property. As much as we all say "focus on the figures," … the truth is that feelings come into buying an investment property too. So in this episode, you'll learn all the emotions you'll face when you purchase an investment property. You'll also learn how to manage these emotions and the tactics you can use to get your head back in the game.

item.title: Tauranga: Is It a Good Place To Invest? (New Data Update)⎜Ep. 1373 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether Tauranga is a good place to invest (or not). We look at how quickly house prices have increased in Tauranga and which parts of Tauranga have seen the fastest capital growth. You'll also get a feel for where Tauranga is in its property cycle. Is it overvalued? Or undervalued? Ultimately, this helps you make an informed decision about whether you want to invest in the Tauranga property market (or not).

item.title: What Happens If I Don't Invest? Retirement Reality Revealed ⎜ Ep. 1372 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss what happens if you don't invest in property. This includes a discussion about which Kiwis need to invest and the idea that every New Zealander need a 'stop work plan'. That's a plan for what happens when you want to stop working. You'll find out the types of people who don't tend to invest and what life looks like if you just live on the NZ Superannuation.

item.title: Splitbanking Simplified … Should I Cheat on My Bank? Pros and Cons Explained ⎜ Ep. 1371 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss 'Split Banking'. This is a mortgage strategy where investors use multiple banks rather than just one. This strategy will help some investors grow their portfolios faster and protect their assets when they begin to sell down. We take you through both the pros and cons of this strategy so you can decide for yourself whether this is the right strategy for you. Transcript

item.title: We Tried Renovating a House – You Won't Believe the Disasters! Reno Horror Stories ⎜ Ep. 1370 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by Ilse Wolfe, a property investor who shares her renovation horror stories. This includes times when tenants have destroyed her properties and other times when renovation projects have become more time-consuming and expensive (through no fault of the property investor). Ultimately this will help you understand the problems that can happen when you renovate. And through this, you'll learn to avoid some of the common mistakes so that you can be a more successful property investor.

item.title: What's Draining Your Cashflow? Top 5 Factors Explained! ⎜ Ep. 1369 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the 5 factors that most impact the cashflow of your investment property. This includes the interest rate, the mortgage type, the cash deposit, the property's tax situation, and the property's yield. Together this will give you a sense of how your property's cashflow could change based on how you set it up. You can also watch the video version of this podcast by heading to the Opes Partners Youtube channel.

item.title: Case Study Sunday – How Much Money Have Opes Investors Made? ⎜ Ep. 1368 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how much money investors who work with Opes Partners have made. Over the years, many investors have asked whether we can share these numbers. Although we often don't like talking about ourselves, we've made an exception here since so many investors have asked the question. This includes comparing how much money the investors have made compared to the rest of the market. This helps you understand how to tell whether someone is good at picking potential investment properties.

item.title: Spot the Difference Challenge: Progressive Payments Build Vs. True Turnkey – Can You Do It? ⎜ Ep. 1367 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how to spot the difference between a progressive payment and turnkey property. This is important for investors to know since progressive payment contracts come with hidden costs. However, telling the difference can be hard since developers will sometimes advertise their properties as 'turnkey' when they're not. This episode will help you tell the difference and find out what to look for when finding properties online.

item.title: Do I Really Need a Mortgage Broker? The Answer May Be No ⎜ Ep. 1366 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether property investors, first-home buyers and homeowners need to use a mortgage broker. This includes discussing who will get value from using a mortgage broker … and who will get less value. We also discuss situations where Kiwis should not use a mortgage broker. Ultimately, this will help you decide whether a mortgage broker is the right fit for you and your financial situation.

item.title: ChatGPT Property Investing Experiment - Epic Win or Epic Fail? ⎜ Ep. 1365 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we do a live experiment to see if (and how) you can use ChatGPT and artificial intelligence to invest in property. We go through 4 different use cases and then decide whether the experiment was an epic win … or an epic fail. This includes: seeing whether property investors can use ChatGPT to create a target list of properties, whether it can analyse a property market, and if artificial intelligence can automate creating letters for your tenants.

item.title: Bonus - From Zero to $100k Building Passive Income Through Property - Webinar audio | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this special bonus episode, you'll hear the audio from the recent Property Live webinar where we looked at 'From Zero to 100k Building Passive Income Through Property' and how to start running the race with your own property portfolio. Transcript

item.title: Rank the Banks – Which Bank Gives You Mortgage Money Easiest? ⎜ Ep. 1364 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we rank the banks. This includes talking about 5 of the major banks in New Zealand (ANZ, BNZ, ASB, Westpac and TSB). We rank them in order of which banks are most willing to lend money based on their income criteria. For this, we are joined by two mortgage advisers – Peter Norris and April Hastilow, both from Catalyst Financial. Of course, this episode is based on the experience of the two brokers (and they don't always agree).

item.title: Don't Buy These! Do Not Invest In These New Build Properties ⎜ Ep. 1363 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this epsiode, we discuss the New Build properties that Kiwis should stay away from. This includes what to look out for when you are searching for a New Build property on TradeMe. The main ones to look out for are: staying away from 1-bed properties and studios, staying away from expensive brand-name developers, watching out for leasehold properties, and also whether the property is turnkey or a progressive payments build.

item.title: Dunedin: Is It a Good Place To Invest? (New Data Update) ⎜ Ep. 1362 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether Dunedin is a good place to invest (right now). This includes a deep dive into the latest data for this student city, and a discussion about which parts of Dunedin could be good for investing. Of course, Dunedin has a lot of young students, which presents its own set of risks. So we talk through how you can handle some of those risks.

item.title: Case Study Sunday: Property on TradeMe Has $70,000 of Hidden Costs ⎜ Ep. 1361 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we compare progressive payments vs turnkey properties. We go through TradeMe to look at the hidden costs of purchasing a progressive payments build and how Kiwi property investors can tell the difference. This analysis shows that a 'seemingly' cheaper property can be more expensive simply because of the hidden costs not disclosed on TradeMe. Ultimately this helps you become a better property investor because you'll know what to look for when evaluating an investment property.

item.title: OCR Peaked – Will Interest Rates Plunge? Reserve Bank Announcement Analysed ⎜ Ep. 1360 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the Reserve Bank's most recent increase in the OCR and how this will impact mortgage interest rates. We analyse the Reserve Bank's press conference and examine how house prices might change based on the bank's analysis. This provides clues about where the OCR may go and how it could impact your property investment strategy. Transcript

item.title: "My Husband Won't Let Me Invest" – What Couples Need to Know ⎜ Ep. 1359 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how couples can get on the same page when it comes to property investment. No, that doesn't mean that one partner convinces the other that they should invest in property ... it's about deciding whether property investment is the right fit for you and your relationship. We go through why couples get into conflict when it comes to property and the 4 ways you can get on the same page.

item.title: Leaky Home Owner Wins $524k Claim Against Housing Inspector – What You Need To Know ⎜ Ep. 1358 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how one leaky homeowner won over half a million dollars from her former building inspector. This homeowner thought she was doing the right thing. She was given a building report from the real estate agent and even called the building inspector to make sure the home wasn't leaky. When she moved in, she quickly realised ... it was. She took the building inspector to court and won!

item.title: Ultimate Power Team for Property Investing – Who's In & What's the Cost? ⎜ Ep. 1357 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, you'll hear from Ilse Wolfe, a property investor and coach from Opes Accelerate. Here, you'll learn how to build a power team for your property investment journey. This includes who you need in your team when you follow a renovation strategy, how to use them and what they cost. This includes how to work with builders, plumbers, electricians, plasterers and valuers. You can then use this information to plan your next renovations-based property investment project.

item.title: 5 Things Investing in Property Will STOP You Doing. Must Listen ⎜ Ep. 1356 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, you'll learn the 5 things that investing in property could stop you from doing. If you borrow hundreds of thousands of dollars to purchase an investment property, the bank might not let you borrow money for other things. This could mean that investing in property stops you from upgrading or renovating your own home. Or it could stop you from borrowing for a new car, a holiday home or buying a business.

item.title: How Much Does It Cost To Invest In Property? Real Numbers + Hidden Costs ⎜ Ep. 1355 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, you'll learn the 3 main costs of investing in property. These include 1) the purchase price, 2) the cashflow of the property and 3) the set-up costs. You'll learn how a standard new build property typically costs between $550k – $1.1 million. However, the rent of this property won't cover all of the costs to own it. That's why investors need to top up their properties by $300 - $500 a week.

item.title: Case Study Sunday: "I'm Single And Own 3 Rental Properties … Here's What I'm Doing Next" ⎜ Ep. 1354 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, you'll hear a case study of an investor who owns 3 rental properties ... despite the fact that she's single. While this investor was doing well, her properties were losing about $770 a week due to interest deductibility tax changes. You'll hear how she plans to restructure her portfolio to turn things around. The strategies we discuss are: selling a property, using an interest-only mortgage, and buying a property with better cashflow.

item.title: Are Dual Income Houses Worth Investing In? Pros and Cons Revealed ⎜ Ep. 1353 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, you'll uncover the truth about dual-income houses. You'll learn both the pros and the cons, so you can decide whether they are the right fit for you. This includes how dual-income houses have higher rental yields and lower risk of vacancy. But you'll also hear the flip side. This includes the higher purchase price, the possibility of lower capital growth, and the unique challenges of reselling such properties.

item.title: "You Raised The Rent Too Much" – Tenant. Here's What Happened at The Tenancy Tribunal ⎜ Ep. 1352 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this epsiode, you'll hear a compelling case study about how a tenant contested a heft $ 100-a-week rent increase. This case ended up at the Tenancy Tribunal. Get the full scoop on both the tenant and landlord's arguments, the backstory, and the Tribunal's ruling. You'll also learn what you need to know when increasing the rent on your investment properties. That way, you'll better understand the dynamics of the property market, rental laws, and maintaining a good relationship with your tenants.

item.title: Will The 39% Trust Tax Smash Your Property Empire? NZ Budget 2023 Revealed! ⎜ Ep. 1351 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the most recent budget released by the government. We talk about the new 39% tax rate for trusts and what this means for property investors. This includes a run-down on whether trusts still make sense. You'll also learn whether you should use a look-through company instead. The epsiode also goes through why the taxes won't harm high-income trusts. Instead, loss-making trusts are the ones who will feel the brunt of the tax change.

item.title: Money In. Money Out. How Your Cashflow Changes Based on Your Deposit ⎜ Ep. 1350 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how the cash deposit you put into a property impacts its cashflow. You'll hear the numbers, including how much cash you'd need to put into a property to make it cashflow neutral. And how the yield of the property impacts this. This gives you a sense of whether you should put a cash deposit into a property or not. Transcript

item.title: Cashing In on Cross Lease Conversions – What Property Investors Need to Know ⎜Ep. 1349 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by Kirstie Winter from Good Title to discuss how you can cash in on converting your cross-lease property. This includes why cross-leases exist, how much it costs to convert a cross-lease property to freehold, and how much your property could increase in value after the conversion is complete. We also let you in on who typically pays for the conversion (is it you and your neighbour, or just you?

item.title: Are We At The Bottom Of The Market? The 6 Graphs You Need to See ⎜ Ep. 1348 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether we are at the bottom of the market and the 6 graphs that you need to see if you're wanting to understand the New Zealand housing market. This is based on a recent episode we did with economist Tony Alexander, where Tony shared which data (and graphs) you need to look at to build your own property investment analysis. We share these graphs and show you exactly where to get the data from (for free).

item.title: Case Study Sunday: Buy a Property For <$300k … How These Investors Did It ⎜ Ep. 1347 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by Ilse Wolfe to discuss a case study of an investor who purchased a property for less than $300k. We talk through where the property was, the condition it was in, and how long it sat on the market. So if you're looking for a screaming good deal as a renovations-focussed property investor, this is the episode to listen to. Ilse also walks us through what renovations the investors did .

item.title: Investors Owe $66K in TAX?! Bright Line Test Tricks ⎜ Ep. 1346 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the bright line test and 2 investors who would accidentally have to pay about $66k in tax. This includes some of the more technical aspects of the bright line, including how the IRD treats subdivisions, flipping your family home and selling a holiday home. Ultimately, this helps you better understand how much tax you might have to pay when buying and selling properties.

item.title: Unseen Bank Tricks: Don't Make These Mistakes on Your New Build Investment Property ⎜ Ep. 1345 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss some of the new build lending secrets that property investors have to know. This includes the key risks that you need to avoid (or manage) as a property investor … and what the banks are offering you. We discuss why you might need to pay a valuer for a completion certificate ... and why you must know about pre-allocated titles. While seemingly technical and boring, these could save you hundreds of thousands of dollars if used right.

item.title: Billionaires Pay Less Tax?! The Truth Revealed ⎜ Ep. 1344 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether billionaires really do pay less tax than the rest of us. This comes from a recent report from the IRD that suggested that the average high-net-worth individual pays less than 9% in tax. Whereas a person earning $80,000 would pay 22% in income tax. We discuss how the IRD came to this conclusion and whether their conclusions are sound. Ultimately, this helps you better understand and interpret the media headlines.

item.title: Free Data: Create Your Own DIY Property Market Analyse With Tony Alexander ⎜ Ep. 1343 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are again joined by Tony Alexander, an independent economist, to discuss how to create your own DIY property market analysis. Of course, if you want to get to grips with the property market, you can read commentary from the likes of Tony. But, what if you want to explore the data yourself? That's where you can use these tips (and free data) to dig into the details and understand what's happening in property.

item.title: Tony Alexander's (Updated) Interest Rate Predictions For 2023 + Beyond ⎜ Ep. 1342 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by independent economist Tony Alexander to discuss what he thinks will happen to interest rates over the next year (and beyond). This includes a prediction that longer-term rates have already peaked and are currently on their way down. He also suggests that the 1-year rate is at (or very near) its peak and will likely be around 6.25% by the same time next year before dropping back to about 5.

item.title: Tony Alexander: Is this the LOWEST of the Low? Tony's House Price Predictions Revealed! ⎜ Ep. 1341 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by independent economist Tony Alexander to discuss what he thinks will happen to house prices over the next few years. This includes his prediction that house prices will bottom out in Winter (somewhere between June and August). He talks us through how quickly the house price recovery could happen and the factors that could impact house prices. Ultimately this lets you make an informed decision (as a property investor) about whether now is the right time to invest (or not).

item.title: Case Study Sunday: Borrow Against Inherited Property To Start Investing? (Shared Equity) ⎜ Ep. 1340 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss what property investors need to know about borrowing against a property they own with other people. This specifically includes a discussion about how to borrow against a property that has been inherited in conjunction with other members of your family. We go through the pros, cons and technicalities of borrowing against a shared property and what permission you need to get from your fellow co-owners.

item.title: Should I Invest in a Dodgy Area? Property Goldmines or Absolute Nightmare? ⎜ Ep. 1339 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether property investors should consider buying a rental property in a 'dodgy' area. This includes a discussion of what a 'dodgy' area is and both the pros and cons of investing in one of these areas. We also mention which suburbs might have attractive opportunities and which ones we would steer away from. Ultimately this lets you make an informed decision about whether to invest in an area that some might be considered 'dodgy'.

item.title: Easier to Develop Property? Medium Density Rules Explained ⎜ Ep. 1338 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the new Medium Density Residential Standards (MDRS). These are a set of new rules that make it easier for property investors to develop their land. The new rules allow investors and homeowners to build up to 3 units on any piece of land (as long as you meet the standards). But are the rules as simple as they seem? And what are the opportunities and fishhooks to look out for?

item.title: Car Loan Hack: Use a Car Loan To Get Your Mortgage Approved ⎜ Ep. 1337 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss when a car loan may actually be a good idea. On the show, we often rail against car loans, calling them bubblegum debt and suggesting that they're not a good idea. Here, we argue the opposite and share some situations where car loans could actually help investors grow a portfolio. Ultimately, this helps you get a sense of whether a car loan may actually help you become a property investor sooner.

item.title: Bonus - The new rules of property investment - Webinar audio | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this special bonus episode, you'll hear the audio from the recent Property Live webinar where we looked at 'The 8 new rules of property investment' and what they mean for property investors and first home buyers. We also unveil the latest research tools on our website: the Data Hub. Transcript

item.title: Ranked: The New Rules of Property Investment – Which Ones Matter? ⎜ Ep. 1336 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we rank the top 8 new rules that have been introduced to the property market over the last 5 years. These include debt-to-income ratios, loan-to-value-ratio restrictions, interest deductibility and 5 more changes. We let you know which ones are the most important and the impact they have had on the property market. You'll also hear how you can adapt your property investment strategy to keep growing your portfolio.

item.title: I Rented My Property in 7 Days (Here's How) ⎜ Ep. 1335 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how Ed rented his property in 7 days. This includes which property he bought, what it rented for, and how it rented so quickly. You can then use the same tactics to get your properties rented as quickly as possible. This includes: renting your property 1-week before settlement, using clear photos, presenting the property as it is (i.e. not with furniture if there's no furniture) and making it easy for tenants to get in contact.

item.title: LVR Game Changer: $217k More Borrowing For This Investor. New Rules Revealed ⎜ Ep. 1334 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the new LVR rules that have just been announced by the Reserve Bank. These changes make it easier for some owner-occupiers to borrow with a lower deposit. But, the big change is that investors purchasing existing properties will soon be allowed to purchase with a 35% deposit rather than a 40% deposit. While that change sounds small, the outcome is impactful. We go through an example of how some investors can borrow an extra $214k after the changes have been announced.

item.title: Case Study Sunday – Tradie Troubles – When to Fire a Tradie ⎜ Ep. 1333 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by property investor Ilse Wolfe. Here, she shares the situations where you might need to fire your tradie. She walks us through a case study of where she's had to fire a tradie and where she's decided to bite the bullet and keep them on. Ultimately this helps you become a more successful property investor by showing when and how to fire a tradie so your renovation project stays on track.

item.title: Subdivision Secrets: How Much Money Can You Make? What Does It Cost? ⎜ Ep. 1332 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how you can make money by using a subdivision strategy. This includes how much your property might go up in value by when you subdivide and how much subdivision can cost. Ultimately, this allows property investors to understand whether subdivision might be the right strategy for them. Hamish and Reuben Frizzel join us from Survus Landsurveyors for this. Just a note, we don't have sponsored guests on the show .

item.title: 4 common problems with real estate agents (and how to fix them) ⎜ Ep. 1331 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the 4 most common problems with real estate agents and how to fix them. According to polling data from Roy Morgan, only 5% of Australians consider real estate agents to have "very high" or "high" ethics and honesty. This makes real estate agents one of the least trusted professions. While there isn't similar data available in New Zealand, it's probably fair to assume that the numbers would be similar in New Zealand.

item.title: Who you sue – "I bought a defective new build … and the developer's gone" ⎜ Ep. 1330 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss what property investors and first home buyers should do if they buy a new build property … and then the developer shuts their company down (liquidates). This is because often after a developer is finished building a project, they will put the company into liquidation. However, this leaves investors thinking, "what happens if there are defects with my new build investment property?" You'll learn who you sue and, ultimately, how to make sure that your new build is put right (if there is a defect).

item.title: What my father taught me about money ... and what he got wrong ⎜ Ep. 1329 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss what our fathers (and mothers) taught us about money and property and what they got wrong. Our parents shape many of our thoughts, attitudes and beliefs about money. Some of the lessons they teach us will be spot on and help us for the rest of our lives. Some of the things we learn can hold us back. Through this, you should consider what your own parents taught you about money and how they've shaped your thoughts about property.

item.title: Landlords fined $284,000 – Largest 5 tenancy tribunal cases ⎜ Ep. 1328 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the 5 largest tenancy tribunal cases in the last 5 years. Collectively these 5 landlords were fined $284,000. You'll learn why these investors had to pay their tenants so much money and the mistakes you can avoid so you don't have to pay such hefty fines. Ultimately, this will help you become a better property investor by showing you what not to do as a property investor.

item.title: War on inflation over? Economists shocked at most recent data ⎜ Ep. 1327 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether the war on inflation is over. Economists were shocked when Statistics NZ recently released data showing that the rate of inflation has fallen to 6.7%, down from 7.2%. We go through the numbers to show the impact on interest rates and what it all means for property investors, homeowners and mortgage borrowers. We also talk about why the number might not be as good as it first seems – and go through the differences between tradeable (imported) and non-tradable (domestic) inflation.

item.title: Case Study Sunday – Can 'channelling' shave 20 years off your mortgage? Truth vs scam ⎜ Ep. 1326 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether the mortgage strategy 'channelling' actually can shave 20 years off your mortgage. Recently we've seen more and more mortgage brokers talking about how to pay off your mortgage more quickly … and promoting jaw-dropping results. Paying off your mortgage more quickly is a good idea ... but can it really be done without making extra repayments? That's what some mortgage brokers claim. We delve into the data and the spreadsheets to put the claims to the test.

item.title: 4 rookie mistakes you’re making when you negotiate with a real estate agent ⎜ Ep. 1325 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the 4 rookie mistakes investors make when negotiating with a real estate agent. This will help you when you are trying to beat the real estate agent on price and get the best deal on an investment property. Ultimately, this will put you in a position of power, so you can be a successful property investor (or first home buyer). For this discussion, we are joined by Micky Limmer, a real estate agent from Opes Property.

item.title: Sell 1, buy 2 strategy – how to grow your property portfolio faster ⎜ Ep. 1324 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the Sell 1 to Buy 2 Strategy. This is where, in some cases, property investors can sell a property from their portfolio … and then purchase 2. This is like taking a step back to take 2 steps forward. We go through which property investors can use this strategy and why and how this strategy works. Ultimately, this will help you make an informed decision about whether you need to sell a property from your portfolio.

item.title: 5% deposit – get into your first home faster with this government programme ⎜ Ep. 1323 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this epsiode, we discuss the First Home Partner programme. This is a government programme that allows first-home buyers to purchase a property with just a 5% deposit. We discuss who is eligible for the programme and also how you practically apply and use it. This lets first-home buyers get a sense of whether this could be the way to get their first house. Transcript

item.title: Bankrupt builders – will Scarbro's collapse cause contagion ⎜ Ep. 1322 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether more builders and developers are about to go bankrupt. This is based on the recent case of Scarbro, a builder located in Auckland. The company recently folded, and some property investors are wondering whether more developers are likely to fold in the future. We discuss the risk of 'contagion' and whether this could cause flow-on effects for other developers. Transcript

item.title: Mortgage approved in 3 days! How to get mortgage approved fast ⎜ Ep. 1321 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how property investors can get their mortgages approved fast. This includes a case study where an investor got their mortgage approved in just 3 days. The key to getting your mortgage approved quickly is by having all of your documents ready to go so that you (the borrower) aren't holding the bank up. While this might sound simple, it's a powerful way to get ahead and speed up your property investment journey.

item.title: Can tenants really do this?! The renovations your tenants can and can't do ⎜ Ep. 1320 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss Section 42 of the Residential Tenancies Act, which now allows tenants to make 'minor changes' to the properties they're renting. We discuss what changes tenants can make and what counts as a 'minor change', and what landlords can say no to. We also walk through case studies where tenants have undertaken renovations ... and whether they were legal or not. Transcript

item.title: Case Study Sunday: $320k negatively geared – how this couple will fix it ⎜ Ep. 1319 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss a case study of two investors who have a negatively geared portfolio that is losing $320k a year in cash flow. While the investors have a sizeable portfolio, the new tax rules and high-interest rates mean that the properties are in the red. We talk through what these investors can do to improve the cash flow of their portfolio and what they'll do to get their property portfolio right for the long term.

item.title: Builder battle - how to pick the right builder for your renovation ⎜ Ep. 1318 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how property investors can choose the right builder for their renovation project. To walk us through what to do, we are joined by property investor Ilse Wolfe. Here, Ilse shares what to look for, what questions to ask and how to create a short list of builders to look at. Ultimately, this will help you find the right builder for your project in any market.

item.title: Top Kiwi property shows that'll skyrocket your investing game ⎜ Ep. 1317 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the top Kiwi property investment shows and series that teaches you about property investment and how to buy your first home. These include shows produced by CoreLogic, Steve Goodey, Tony Alexander, Property Couch and Michael Yardney. Ultimately this allows people to continue learning about property investment ... even if you don't feel like paying for it. Transcript

item.title: Property investment courses and seminars - mind-blowing value or just hot air and hype? ⎜ Ep. 1316 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether property investment seminars offer mind-blowing value or whether they are just hot air. This includes the pros and cons of these seminars, what they cost, and whether you can just get the same information online for free. The seminars discussed include those produced by Tama Singh, Michael Burge, and those produced by Kenyon Clarke and Steve Goodey. Transcript

item.title: The bank said no … bought a house anyway – non-bank lender case studies ⎜ Ep. 1315 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we go through three case studies of investors who were turned down by the bank but who have purchased properties anyway. We go through which non-bank lenders each investor used and what would have gone wrong if they couldn't get the money to settle the properties they were already committed to buying. Ultimately this well help investors purchasing new builds and existing properties to renovate.

item.title: How did these get approved? - Worst building materials in NZ history ⎜ Ep. 1314 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the worst building materials in history. This is so first-home buyers, homeowners and property investors can know what to look out for when going to open homes and inspecting potential property purchases. These materials include dux quest piping, weatherside cladding, asbestos, lead-based paint and monolithic cladding. We also go through what can go wrong if you buy a property that has some of these building materials used on or within the property.

item.title: "I can't afford a house" - new mortgage rules from the Reserve Bank ⎜ Ep. 1313 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the debt-to-income ratios (DTIs) that have recently been introduced by the Reserve Bank. We discuss how the Reserve Bank has granted itself the power to bring in debt-to-income ratios at any time and the timeframe and circumstances for when and how they could be introduced. We go through what this means for lending policy and what this could mean for the future of capital growth.

item.title: Case study Sunday - the council swapped my suburb ⎜ Ep. 1312 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss a case study where an investor had their "suburb swapped" by the local council. We discuss how this happened and what it means both for the rent and the future value of the property. Ultimately this will be beneficial for all investors, home buyers and first-home buyers who purchase properties on the border of two suburbs. Transcript

item.title: OCR up – are interest rates set to surge? Interest rate forecast ⎜ Ep. 1311 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether interest rates will increase after the Reserve Bank's most recent OCR announcement. Andrew and Ed walk through what the Reserve Bank announced in their latest press releases and what's happening with wholesale interest rates. Ultimately property investors can use this information to decide how long to fix their interest rate for. We also mention Andrew's weekly newsletter Private Property which you can sign up for by clicking the link.

item.title: 9 Things That Could Go Wrong with your New Build Investment Property (And How to Fix It) ⎜ Ep. 1310 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the 9 things that could go wrong with your new build investment property – specifically while it's under construction. You'll also learn how to fix any issues as they arise. The potential problems include: 1) what if the property drops in value during construction, 2) if the expenses on the property change, 3) if the bank won't lend you the money once the property is built, And 6 other potential issues.

item.title: Should I Buy My First Home If … Setting Down Roots or Spreading Your Wings ⎜ Ep. 1309 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether first-home buyers should bite the bullet and purchase a property if they plan to move overseas within the next couple of years. This is based on a question asked by Ravi – an attendee at one of our recent first-home buyer events. We walk first-home buyers through what they need to think about, including: 1) whether they will actually move overseas, 2) what your living situation will be if you move, 3) whether you'll want to come back to New Zealand, and 4) what you think the market will do over before you move overseas?

item.title: Bonus - The 2 to 5 property leap - How to grow your property investment portfolio - Webinar audio | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this special bonus episode, you'll hear the audio from the recent Property Live webinar where we looked at 'The 2 to 5 property leap- How to grow your property investment portfolio' where we looked at strategies to grow your property portfolio. Transcript

item.title: The Do's and Don'ts of Open Homes - What To Look For + What Not to Say ⎜ Ep. 1308 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the do's and don'ts of open homes. This includes what to look for and what not to say. We give you tips on what to ask your real estate agent so you can negotiate hard and also why you don't need to worry too much about how the property is built. Ultimately this episode will help first-home buyers, movers and property investors know what to do at an open home.

item.title: 6 Most Common Renovation Ideas (And Whether They Actually Make You Money) ⎜ Ep. 1307 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by Ilse Wolfe to discuss the 6 most common renovation ideas that property investors have in New Zealand … and whether they actually make you any money. We've specifically chosen renovation ideas that are not already included within the Cashflow Hacking process since we already frequently talk about these. The ideas discussed include adding a deck to a property, double glazing the windows, landscaping, painting the exterior of the house and adding solar panels.

item.title: To Buy or Not To Buy - "I Want to Wait 6 Months To See How The Market Goes" ⎜ Ep. 1306 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether property investors should wait 6 months before they start investing in property. We go through the cost of waiting 6 months to buy a property and how much property prices tend to change over any given 6-month period. This helps us understand how property prices might change over time and gives you a sense of whether you should wait 6 months to invest (or not).

item.title: Case Study Sunday: Interest Only Loans – When Do They Make Sense for Property Investors ⎜ Ep. 1305 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss a case study with Andrew Nicol about when property investors should use interest-only mortgages. Andrew shares how a pair of investors he's been working with was a bit confused about whether they should use a principal and interest or interest-only mortgage. Andrew shares what they decided to go for and the three key reasons why. Ultimately this allows you, as a property investor, to decide which sort of mortgage you should use.

item.title: Property Investment Nightmares (And How To Fix Them) - A Guide Based on 3 Real-Life Stories ⎜ Ep. 1304 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss 3 different property investment nightmares and how to fix them. These case studies come from real posts on the Property Investors Chat Group, a popular New Zealand Facebook group. This is to show you not only what can go wrong in property investment ... but also how to avoid these bad things happening in the first place. We also mention that the new Opes Partners website has just gone live.

item.title: Top 8 Property Lawyers in New Zealand – The Legal Eagles You Need to Know ⎜ Ep. 1303 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we go through a list of the top 8 property lawyers in New Zealand. This includes property lawyers across Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch. This gives property investors a range of lawyers they could potentially use when investing in property. We also share the number of deals we've worked on with each lawyer so you have the confidence that these recommendations are based on experience. Transcript

item.title: Airbnb Investing 101 - How to Research and Find Areas for Your Short Term Rental ⎜ Ep. 1302 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how investors can choose properties that work as short-term rentals on Airbnb and other platforms. We talk through how to choose the right area to invest in and then how to analyse the area using AirDNA. Ultimately this teaches property investors what numbers to look for when considering investment properties for the short-term rental market. Transcript

item.title: Big vs Small Developer – Does Size Matter? Pros and Cons of Each ⎜ Ep. 1301 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether property investors should choose to purchase from a big or small developer when buying a new build property. This includes the pros and cons of both options so investors can decide which is the best option for them. Transcript

item.title: 5 Reasons Property Prices WON'T Turn Around This Year – Part #2 ⎜ Ep. 1300 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we follow up on yesterday's episode and share the 5 reasons why property prices won't turn around in 2023. This includes the risk of persistent and ongoing inflation, house prices that some consider still too high, and incoming taxes that impact property investors. Ultimately this property market update allows investors to make an informed decision about when to purchase their next investment. Transcript

item.title: 6 Reasons Property Prices Could Turn Around This Year – Part #1 ⎜ Ep. 1299 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the 6 reasons that property prices could turn around in 2023. These reasons include positive net migration, improving house-price-to-income ratios, rising wages, a tight labour market and improving house price momentum. This allows property investors to consider when they should make their next investment. This episode effectively doubles as a property market update. To keep things balanced, in tomorrow's episode, we'll talk through the 5 reasons why property prices won't turn around in 2023.

item.title: Case Study Sunday: $140k Passive Income in 20 Years Through Property – How This Couple Will Do It ⎜ Ep. 1298 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by Derry Brown – a property investor and financial adviser. Here we discuss a case study of some of the investors Derry has been working with. He shares how this couple plans to build a passive income of $140k over the next 20 years. And we also mention our My Wealth Plan software which is absolutely free to use and find out how much of a wealth gap you have.

item.title: Getting Money For Renovations – Review of Liberty Finance ⎜ Ep. 1297 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we review Liberty Finance and the lending products they offer for renovations-focused investors. We go through the types of loans the non-bank lender offers and how they can be used by investors to keep investing even when the main banks say no. This includes discussing situations where Liberty will lend to investors with as little as a 20% deposit. This lets property investors begin their property journey with less money.

item.title: The Du Val Dilemma: Will Du Val Go Broke? What Property Investors Need to Know ⎜ Ep. 1296 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether Du Val – an Auckland-based property developer – will go broke in the near future. We detail the warnings the Financial Markets Authority has sounded about the developer's mortgage funds. We also discuss the recent news that a Du Val-related entity has gone into a court-ordered liquidation. Finally we discuss how long their properties are taking to be built, and how that could impact the cash flow for the business.

item.title: Borrowing Money Through Look Through Companies – What Property Investors Need to Know ⎜ Ep. 1295 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the finer details of borrowing money to invest through a look-through company. When an investor decides to purchase a property through a look-through company (or a trust) they will often need to sign a personal guarantee. This means that if the investor stops paying the mortgage, they are on the hook for the money they owe (rather than the trust of the look-through company.

item.title: Interest Only Loan Extensions: How To Keep Getting Interest Only On Your Investment Properties ⎜ Ep. 1294 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how an investor can continue borrowing money on interest-only for as long as possible. This is based on the story of a Queenstown-based investor who messaged into the show and is struggling to get her mortgages approved for interest-only. This is causing stress for her household budget as all her mortgages are currently on principal and interest. Transcript

item.title: How to Read a Property Management Statement – A Guide for Property Investors ⎜ Ep. 1293 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how to read a property management statement. We go through real examples of property management statements, picking up on any anomalies within the statements. Ultimtaely this will help property investors get a sense of what money comes in and goes out when working with a property manager. Transcript

item.title: Misleading! Developer's Cashflow Trap Revealed + Hidden Risks of Developer-Provided Cashflows ⎜ Ep. 1292 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss a set of financial projections that have been prepared and marketed by Williams Corporation. We go through the numbers presented in these cashflows and unpack whether they are robust (or not). This includes looking at whether all the correct expenses have been included, whether the rent is correct ... and even whether the purchase price is correct. All of this is so property investors can understand the hidden risks of accepting a developer provided cashflow.

item.title: Case Study Sunday: Millionaire at 26 – Simran Kaur From Girls That Invest Shares Her Property Journey ⎜ Ep. 1291 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by Simran (Sim) Kaur from Girls That Invest to discuss how she became a millionaire at 26. We walk through her property investment journey and talk about the first home she purchased in Hamilton, and how she's renovated the property. We also discuss her next moves in property and how she splits her investing between shares and real estate. Transcript

item.title: Is Mary Holm Wrong? Ed + Andrew Respond to Mary Holm's Comments in the NZ Herald ⎜ Ep. 1290 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss a recent column written by Mary Holm for the New Zealand Herald. This column discusses whether a potential property investor in Auckland should buy an investment property (or not). We go through Mary's column line by line to show whether we agree with her advice or not. Ultimately this is to show the differences between New Zealand financial commentators, including their points of agreement and disagreement.

item.title: Renovation Costs: How Much Does a Renovation Cost? ⎜ Ep. 1289 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by property investor, Ilse Wolfe from Opes Accelerate⁠, to discuss how much a renvoation costs for an investment property. We walk through each of the Cashflow Hacking steps going through exactly what each step costs. Ilse shares that the average renovation typically costs between $60 - $80k, and that the sweet spot is usually $65k. However, this depends on the value of the property and a number of other factors.

item.title: Pay Up: What To Do When Your Tenant Doesn't Pay Rent ⎜ Ep. 1288 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss what property investors and landlords should do if their tenants don't pay rent. This includes the practical steps to take (such as contacting your tenants) and the specific legal steps you need to take. This is useful for property investors ... even if you use a property manager. This is because you need to understand the steps that your property manager will take to get the rent paid and anything they can do to remedy the situation.

item.title: Declined: Tenancy Tribunal Says “You Can’t Increase The Rent That Much” ⎜ Ep. 1287 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss a recent Tenancy Tribunal case where the adjudicator determined that the property investor had set the rent too high. We go through the tenant's response and how that decision to increase the rent impacted the landlord/tenant relationship. We also discuss what the tribunal's decision really means for property investors and whether there is a limit to how much a property investor can increase the rent for their tenants.

item.title: What Insurance Do Property Investors Need … And When Can I Cancel It? ⎜ Ep. 1286 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the different types of insurance that property investors need. Rather than cover the standard insurance like house insurance and landlord's insurance, we dig into life insurance, income protection insurance and mortgage protection insurance. We go through the instances when these types of insurance would be useful to a property investor, and the point when a property investor could comfortably cancel these policies. Ultimately this helps property investors understand the types of insurance policies they might need (and the ones that they don't).

item.title: The West Coast: A Hidden Gem for Property Investors? ⎜ Ep. 1285 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether property investors should consider investing in the West Coast, a small region in the South Island. We go through the reasons why property investors have historically been interested in the West Coast – namely the cheap property prices and the relatively high rental yields. However, we go through some of the reasons that should give investors pause, such as – the declining population, the derelict state of some of the houses in the region, and the relatively low population of tenants.

item.title: Case Study Sunday: Blenheim Couple Creates $120k Passive Income Plan ⎜ Ep. 1284 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss a case study of a couple from Blenheim who has created a plan to build a $120,000 passive income. Andrew walks us through the story of how Aaron and Natasha were both 57 when they first met Andrew. At the time they had already paid off their own home. They'd also put a sizeable cash deposit down on an invetment porperty that was currently under costruction.

item.title: Staging Secrets – How to Sell Your Property for Way More Money ⎜ Ep. 1283 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by Carl Comber from Comber and Comber to talk about how to stage your property the right way.
