We also go through rental data to determine whether rents are likely to rise in response to landlord's increasing costs, and whether capital growth can still be expected in the future. We also mention that because of these changes we are introducing a new service where Andrew will review investors portfolios to help them decide what changes to make (if any).

item.title: "House Prices Will Not Fall" ... How The Govt's First Home Buyer Support Locks In Today's House Prices⎜Ep. 563 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the final parts of the government's housing announcements, which were released earlier in the week. These measures include allowing more first home buyers to access government support and new funding for infrastructure. Counterintuitively, we argue that more support for first home buyers, particularly those accessing the housing market with a 5% deposit, will actually lock in today's house prices as the government cannot allow hosue prices to drop away.

item.title: Bright Line Test Extended – NZ's Capital Gains Tax About To Get Tougher ... But Does It Matter For Me? ⎜Ep. 562 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the government's recent announcement that the Bright Line Tests is about to get tougher. Any capital gains you make on a property will be taxable unless you hold the property for 10 years, rather than the previous 5 years.  This will impact NZ property investors around the country. But, it will also be felt by homeowners who temporarily rent out their home e.g. because they move away for work.

item.title: 6 Ways To Change Your Investment Strategy To Combat Labour's Tax Announcements⎜Ep. 561 | The Property Academy Podcast
Breaking News: Government To Tax Property Investors More – Interest Deductibility Removed!⎜Ep. 560 | The Property Academy Podcast
Should I Allow My Tenants To Have Pets in My Rental Property?⎜Ep. 559 | The Property Academy Podcast
How Much Money Do You Need To Be Happy In NZ? [Exact Numbers] And How Do You Get It Through Property?⎜Ep. 558 | The Property Academy Podcast
'How To Get Rich For Certain' Through Property Investment⎜Ep. 557 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are once again joined by Matthew Harris from Momentum Property. Here, we discuss how to get rich ... for certain with property investment.  Matt details what he means by 'for certain', which is through the concept of incremental gain. Buying and holding property for the long term provides incremental gains in most years, through increased rents and property values. This provides a steady increase in wealth over time.

item.title: What is the Wealth Wheel? And How Do I Use It To Keep Growing A Portfolio Indefinitely?⎜Ep. 556 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are once again joined by Matthew Harris from Momentum Property, to discuss the Wealth Wheel approach to property investment.  This is where a property investor will purchase both positively and negatively geared investments, which then offset one another. In practice, this means purchasing enough higher yield property to pay for the investment properties that grow in value quickly, but which lose money in terms of  cash flow.

item.title: How to Start With a 2nd Tier Lender Before Moving To a Main Bank – With Special Guest Matt Harris⎜Ep. 555 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how to use 2nd tier lenders and financers as part of your property investment strategy. We also go through how to start with a 2nd tier lender before moving across to a first tier. This includes an analysis of exactly how to move between the two. We also announce that we will host property investment dinners in Wellington, Auckland, Christchurch and Queenstown, with 10 investors (+ partners) at each.

item.title: Case Study: Real Property Investor, Matthew Harris Shares His Journey + Portfolio⎜Ep. 554 | The Property Academy Podcast
Should I Invest In The Nelson / Tasman District? Regional Property Market Deep-Dive⎜Ep. 553 | The Property Academy Podcast
How Do I calculate the True 'Return on Investment' on a Property?⎜Ep. 552 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the various ways to calculate the return on investment when considering investing in property, along with their pros and cons. We discuss gross yields, cash yields, net yields, return on equity, and finally reveal our holy grail – a return on investment calculator. This gives you the inflation-adjusted return on your investment property from each of the main ways you can make money from a property.

item.title: What's The Worst Case, Nightmare-Scenario For Property Investment? ⎜Ep. 551 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the absolute worst-case, nightmare scenario in property investment. This comes from a listener of the show who wants to know the exact worst of the worst situation. This includes considering large scale natural disasters, a housing market crash, and the possibility of your asset falling in value while retaining debt. We also announce that we will host property investment dinners in Wellington, Auckland, Christchurch and Queenstown, with 10 investors (+ partners) at each.

item.title: How To Analyse A Suburb Before You Invest – A Worked Example of Manurewa ⎮ Ep. 550 | The Property Academy Podcast
How to Build a House Before Paying For The Land. What Are 'Builder's Terms'? And How Do You Get Them? ⎮ Ep. 549 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we talk about what 'Builder's Terms' are and how property investors get them. Builder's terms are where you are able to build a house, or group of houses, on a piece of land before you've paid for the land. This is because there are generally two types of developers in major subdivisions – land developers and builders. Here, the builder doesn't pay the land developer until they've sold and settled the house.

item.title: Tenants Cause Intentional Damage – Landlord Awarded $9.1k. What Property Investors Can Learn ⎮ Ep. 548 | The Property Academy Podcast
Is This The End For Interest Only Loans? The Reserve Bank To Consider Limiting IO For Investors ⎮ Ep. 547 | The Property Academy Podcast
Master Build vs Builder's Guarantee – Which Is Better? ⎮ Ep. 546 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we compare the Master Build guarantee vs a Builder's guarantee. The main point property investors need to understand is that these guarantees are insurance products. They are not a guarantee from the builder themselves about the quality of the build. We compare and contrast the benefits of each and talk about some of the fishhooks and pitfalls, where property investors have been caught off. guard.

item.title: Top 10 Different Property Investment Strategies + How They Make You Money ⎮ Ep. 545 | The Property Academy Podcast
How Do I "Go Hard + Go Early" In Property Investment? ⎮ Ep. 544 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how to apply the "go hard + go early" mentality to property investment. This comes from a listener of the show who wonders whether the government's current approach to tackling Covid-19 could be applied to getting started with property.  We go through the first two stages of financial life – Planters and Growers – and talk about how you could go hard + go early at each stage.

item.title: The Reserve Bank Now to Regulate Property Investors Further ... What You Need to Know ⎮ Ep. 543 | The Property Academy Podcast
How Long Will Interest Rates Stay Low? ... The Reserve Bank's Latest Monetary Policy Update ⎮ Ep. 542 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the latest monetary policy update from the Reserve Bank. Practically, nothing changed. The OCR stayed the same and the Large Scale Asset Purchasing Programme remains as does the Funding for Lending Programme. But, there was much to be gained from the Reserve Bank Governor's speech. He expects interest rates to continue falling – and is looking closely at banks to see whether there is a full 'pass through' of the Reserve Bank's programmes.

item.title: What Do The 5 Healthy Homes Standards Really Mean + When Do They Come In? ⎮ Ep. 541 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we detail the 5 Healthy Homes standards: draught stopping, insulation, heating, ventilation and drainage. We go through each, including the responsibilities that property investors and landlords have. These regulations come in officially from 1st July 2021. But, property investors don't have to comply until 90 days after they sign a new tenancy agreement. If you've got a topic that you'd like to hear about on the podcast, then send us a text.

item.title: How Much Debt Should You Have in Your Portfolio? And How Will That Change Over Time?⎟Ep. 540 | The Property Academy Podcast
How Can I Make Money From RMA Reform As a Property Investor? ⎮ Ep. 539 | The Property Academy Podcast
How Will Ongoing Lockdowns Impact Auckland's Property Market? ⎮ Ep. 538 | The Property Academy Podcast
Will The Government Tax Property Investors More By Removing Interest Deductions? ⎮ Ep. 537 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether the government might tax property investors more by changing the rules around interest deductibility for investment properties. We detail the UK precedent and go through the reasons why the UK has stopped property investors from claiming interest as a tax-deductible expense. We also detail how property investors would tend to react if such a policy came into force. If you've got a topic that you'd like us to talk about on the show, then send us a text.

item.title: Our Top 10 Tools + Software + Content For Property Investors – Part 2 ⎮ Ep. 536 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss our favourite tools, software and content for property investors that haven't been created on the Opes Partners website.  These include: Calculate.co.nz – an NZ calculator based website PocketSmith – an NZ personal finance and budgeting tool, and Kitt.io – a piece of software for property investors to self manage their portfolios Along with many, many more. If you've got a topic that you'd like us to talk about on the show, then send us a text.

item.title: Our Top 10 Tools + Software + Content For Property Investors – Part 1 ⎮ Ep. 535 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss our top 10 tools and pieces of software for property investors that are specifically available on the Opes Partners website. These include: Capital growth and yield maps for Auckland, Christchurch, Hamilton and Wellington The new property investment articles section, and The property investment webinar library Plus many more If you've got a topic that you'd like us to talk about on the show, then send us a text.

item.title: Data Day: What's Going On In The Property Market, Right Now? ⎮ Ep. 534 | The Property Academy Podcast
Rapid Fire: 25 Property Investment Questions Answered In Under 12.5 Minutes ⎮ Ep. 533 | The Property Academy Podcast
Should I Invest In An Apartment As a 1st Step in Property Investment? ⎮ Ep. 532 | The Property Academy Podcast
Should I Get a Relationship Property Agreement? + How To Set One Up ⎮ Ep. 531 | The Property Academy Podcast
Which of the 3 Stages of Life In Property Are You In? ⎮ Ep. 530 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we talk about the three stages of life that property investors tend to go through. This comes from a recent article that Andrew penned for JUNO investing magazine, which has just hit the supermarket shelves. The three stages include planters, growers and harvesters. Throughout the show, we give details on what these stages are, who tends to be in each of them and then how to move from one to another.

item.title: Which Company Has the Most Affordable Real Estate Agent's Fees?⎮ Ep. 529 | The Property Academy Podcast
How To Recover + Rebuild Your Assets After Divorce ⎮ Ep. 528 | The Property Academy Podcast
8 New Tenancy Law Changes that Have Just Been Introduced ... What Property Investors Need to Know ⎮ Ep. 527 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss 8 new changes that have just been introduced to the Residential Tenancies Act, including exactly what they mean for property investors.  These 8 changes include – that property investors can no longer end a tenancy agreement without a valid reason; that tenants can make minor changes to their properties and landlords can't say no, and the lines for getting it all wrong have also increased.

item.title: Main Cities vs Small Towns – Which is Better For Property Investors? Webinar Recap ⎮ Ep. 526 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether main cities or small towns are better for property investors. Andrew and Ed go back and forth to offer three arguments each. Andrew argues that main cities have better security of tenancy and capital growth, along with more consistent capital growth. He also argues that main cities and small towns have comparable long term net yields (contrary to what many property investors think).

item.title: 16%+ Gross Yields – But Does That Make Leasehold Properties a Good Investment? ⎮Ep. 525 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether leasehold properties are good investment. We go through a few examples where properties are able to achieve a gross yield of over 16%. However, once the net yield and cashflow are calculated, we see that these types of properties give a subpar return, all things considered. If you've got a topic you'd like Ed and Andrew to talk about on the podcast, then send us a text.

item.title: Can I Get A Loan If My Property Has Un-consented Work + Deep Dive On Defective Titles⎪Ep. 524 | The Property Academy Podcast
Is Pokeno A Good Investment? & Should I Invest in Pokeno? ⎮Ep. 523 | The Property Academy Podcast
Who Are The Top 7 Property Managers in NZ? Our Top Property Management Picks⎪Ep. 522 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss who the top 7 property managers are within New Zealand. This is based on the property managers who we know, like and trust to do an awesome job with your property. These property managers include Auckland Property Management, Property Scouts, HouseSmart, Quinovic, Oaks Property Management, Glasshouse, Comprende and a bonus: Venture Property Management. Finally, we wrap up the show by discussing our upcoming property investment webinar.

item.title: Can You Buy NZ Property As a Foreigner? Who Can Buy and When⎪Ep. 521 | The Property Academy Podcast
Investors Lost $85 Million With This Company – What Went Wrong With Blue Chip? | Ep. 520 | The Property Academy Podcast
Investors Require 40% Deposits – But Who Will Be Impacted Most?⎜Ep. 519 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how property investors now require 40% deposits if purchasing through BNZ and ASB. This episode was recorded just before the RBNZ released their new announcement about LVR changes. Since this episode was recorded, we know know that LVRs will be coming back at 30% from the 1st of March. These will then increase to 40% from the 1st of May. Throughout the show we also discuss which types of investors are likely to be most impacted by these changes.

item.title: Can You Insure Against Meth Contamination? How To Protect Yourself Against the Big Risks | Ep. 518 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined for our final insurance-based episode by Simon Yarrell from Axico. Here, we discuss whether insurance companies will cover your investment properties against meth contamination. Some insurance companies will protect you in the event of contamination through your normal house insurance. But, importantly, not all will. This is important because the costs to fix a contaminated home can be $20-$40k depending on the damage.

item.title: Sweet-Talking the Bank ... Is It Ever Ok To Tell Fibs To Get Your Lending Approved?⎜Ep. 517 | The Property Academy Podcast
How Parental Leave Impacts Your Property Investment Portfolio⎜Ep. 516 | The Property Academy Podcast
What's The Right Way To Increase The Rent On My Investment Property?⎜Ep. 515 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how to increase the rent on your investment properties the right way. We walk through the steps you legally need to take, for instance giving 60 days written notice to your tenants, with a start date. we also go through what happens if your tenant doesn't agree with how you've increased the rent and the process you need to go through to come to an arrangement.

item.title: Landlords Publish A "Bad Tenant" List ... Here's How They Broke The Law | Ep. 514 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss a recent article published in Stuff where landlords have published a "Bad tenants" list, which falls in breach of the Privacy Act. These landlords have clearly been hurt by tenants in the past, which suggests that they've become too emotionally involved with their portfolios, and haven't been able to separate themselves from the business. You'll hear the key takeouts, along with the lessons for your own property investment portfolio.

item.title: How Insurance Works For Townhouses and Body Corporates ... What Investor Need to Know | Ep. 513 | The Property Academy Podcast
Insurance Prices Up 3x in Some NZ Regions ... How the Insurance Industry Is Changing | Ep. 512 | The Property Academy Podcast
The Top Insurances Property Investors Need ... & A Few You Don't | Ep. 511 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by Simon Yarrell from Axico to discuss the insurance market in New Zealand. Here we go through the key types of insurance that property investors should get ... and a few that may not be as important.  The first type of insurance discussed is house insurance. Here, we discuss the changes that have occurred in the way that companies grant insurance and what they will insure, since the Canterbury earthquakes.

item.title: How Do Non-Bank Lenders Work? And Who Are They Right For? | Ep. 510 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the mechanics of how non-bank lenders work. We go through who they are right for and how they can be a good fit for people with poor credit or who don't have the documentation available to be eligible for a loan from the main retail banks. Non-bank lenders are also often used for a short-transitionary period between the settlement of a property and refinancing away to one of the main banks.

item.title: GV's, How Much Attention Do You Pay To Them? + How Do You Find Out What A Property Is Worth? | Ep. 509 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how to figure out what a property is worth ... and also how much attention you should be paying to the government valuation, which is routinely seen on property advertising.  We discuss that the best way to figure out what a property is worth is by requesting an e-value of avm report from either Core Logic of Valocity. Failing that, a combination of Homes.

item.title: Is 'Build To Rent' A Good Investment? + Will It Take Off In NZ? | Ep. 508 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether Build to Rent is a good investment and whether we think it will take off in New Zealand. Build to Rent is a way of investing in real estate, which is currently being promoted by Du Val Partners.  Here, accredited investors – those with investment qualifications or a net worth of over $5 million – can buy a share in a large number of units.

item.title: 7 Things We've Changed Our Minds On ... Aka 7 Times We Were Wrong | Ep. 507 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss 7 things that we have changed our minds on throughout our careers and since starting this show. These include: That renovations are the only way to become a proper real estate investor That big cities go up in value faster than smaller towns, and   That stand-alone houses go up in value more quickly than townhouses We also mention that we are looking to bring on financial advisers in Auckland, Christchurch and Wellington.

item.title: 9 Quick and Dirty Reno's You Can Do To Add-Value To an Investment Property | Ep. 506 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss 9 quick and dirty renovation projects you can use to increase the value of your investment and rental properties. These include simple tactics like using Bar Keeper's Friend, right through to doing a full-scale bathroom replacement.  We also go through which projects to do first if you are on a tight budget, while also considering whether some of the traditional wisdom from data providers, like Core Logic, really stacks up.

item.title: Revealed: The Top 5 Property Accountants in NZ | Ep. 505 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the Top 5 property accountants that we can hand-on-heart recommend to the investors we tend to work with. These include: Matthew Harris from Momentum Property Matthew Gilligan from Gilligan Rowe Peter Taylor from BDS Accountants Jane Jackman from Nexia Mark Withs from Withers Tsang We also mention that we are looking to bring on financial advisers in Auckland, Christchurch and Wellington. Click the links to check out the job description.

item.title: How AfterPay and LayBuy Can Impact Your Ability to Invest | Ep. 504 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how AfterPay, LayBuy and other short-term 'buy now, pay later' providers can impact your property investment and home-buying plans.  If the bank sees regular payments being made to these providers, they will decrease the amount of income that you have available to service a mortgage in their calculations. A $50 a week payment can mean that the amount you can borrow falls by up to $40,000.

item.title: How Do I Know If It's a Dud Property That I Should Walk Away From? | Ep. 503 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how to tell whether a property you currently own is a 'dud' property that you should move on from and sell ... or not.  Here, Andrew walks through some telltale signs ... as well as how people tend to walk into and acquire dud properties. Usually, this happens when investors turn their own home into a rental, acquire one through inheritance, or buy something down the road.

item.title: KiwiBuild ... It's Basically Like Winning 2nd Division Lotto | Ep. 502 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this epiosde, we discuss KiwiBuild and the benefits of purchasing a KiwiBuild home through the ballot system. This is because first home buyers, in some cases, are purchasing their first homes up to $300,000 under value.  Throughout the show, we give an example from Ormiston in Auckland. Here, a first home buyer paid $650,000 for a property that is expected to be worth $950,000 at completion. First home buyers in these situations are then able to purchase an investment property using the equity within that home.

item.title: Practical Steps You Can Take To Not Be Emotional In Property Investment | Ep. 501 | The Property Academy Podcast
#500 – The End Game in Property Investment and The Property Academy Podcast | Ep. 500 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the end game in property investment and house price growth. This includes playing clips from Jacinda Ardern's 7th December press conference, and several clips from the leader's debates.  We also talk about the rise in household income growth, which has been solidly above 4% for the last 12 years in New Zealand. This includes a massive 7%+ increase in incomes during 2018. This suggests that even if house price growth falls to the rate of income growth, house price inflation could be solid into the future.

item.title: How Do I Negotiate Down My Interest Rate With The Bank? | Ep. 499 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how to negotiate down your interest rate with the bank. This includes making sure that you are asking for a rate-discount, and how much to expect you could get off your rates. After the key tactics, we walk through how to make yourself look more attractive to a bank, to ensure that you're the sort of customer that a bank actively wants to attract.

item.title: Serviceability – What's The Minimum Income I Need to Buy My Next Property? | Ep. 498 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss serviceability ... which answers the question "do I have enough income to get my mortgage approved through my bank? We go through the minimum bank expenses that ANZ currently assumes that you pay each month, along with how that changes based on how many people you have within your household. This episode is based on a minimum income calculator, which we recently released. This allows you to put in details about your household composition and see the minimum income you'd be required to have in order to get your next investment property approved.

item.title: Data Day: The Top 5 Concerns Of Buyers Right Now + The Latest House Price Data | Ep. 497 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the latest property market data released from the Real Estate Insititute of New Zealand. Some of the key takeaways include that property prices rose by over 2% in the month of December ... and the number of homes sold in Auckland for the month was up 66% on 12 months prior. We also detail the top concerns that buyers have in the market right now, and how those have changed over the last 6 months .

item.title: How to Win At Tenders + Auctions To Get a Good Deal. Part #3 | Ep. 496 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how to be successful and win in Tender and Auction sales processes. This is the third part of our three-part series looking at each of the different sales processes we use in New Zealand, with how to be successful in each.  Here, we go through tactics you can use to pull on the human side of the person selling their property, such as writing handwritten letters .

item.title: How to Win In 'Price By Negotiation' + 'Deadline Sale' Processes. Part #2 | Ep. 495 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how to be successful In price by negotiations and deadline sales processes as a buyer. This includes a discussion of age-old negotiation techniques, such as crossing out prices, and whether these are still relevant in today's market.  If you're an investor looking for the right types of properties, then these techniques should help you have the confidence to negotiate and get a good deal.

item.title: The 4 Ways To Buy and Sell Properties In NZ ... And How to Be Successful In Each – Part 1 | Ep. 494 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the four main sales processes in New Zealand and when each one of them should be used. These include 'price by negotiation',  tenders, auctions, and 'deadline sales'. We conclude that the right process for you is going to be based on both the type of property you have and where your local property market is within its cycle. That's because some processes are geared towards markets that have more competition and others are better when there are less people looking for properties at the time you sell your house.

item.title: Where the Cheapest Rates Are In NZ ... And Why It Matters | Ep. 493 | The Property Academy Podcast
At What Point Can I Start Taking Profits From My Portfolio? | Ep. 492 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss at what point you should take profits from your property portfolio. This is both in terms at what point in terms of your financial life, and then also in terms of the property cycle. Our conclusion is that it's only right to take profits from your portfolio as a long term buy and hold investor once you are comfortably on track to hit your long term goals, otherwise you'll be making a sacrifice.

item.title: Here's How to Manage Your Property Investment Bank Accounts | Ep. 491 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how to manage your property investment bank accounts so that you don't go into unarranged overdraft or miss an important mortgage payment.  The strategy discussed is to set up your accounts so that all rent from all properties goes into the same account, with all expenses also coming out of that account. This saves you from having to move money around and each property can subsidise each other temporarily if needed.

item.title: How Will Prefabricated Factory-Made Homes Disrupt the Property Market? | Ep. 490 | The Property Academy Podcast
Are You Concerned About The Quality Of Some of the Developments Being Thrown Up? | Ep. 489 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the things in new developments that is concerning Andrew today, along with whether we are likely to see another leaky homes crisis – or something similar – in the future. item.title: How Will Rising Sea Levels and Climate Change Impact Property Investment? | Ep. 488 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how climate change and rising sea levels impact property investment. We answer questions like "what will happen if you invest in a property near the sea and sea levels start to rise" along with "how is coastal erosion impacting property investment?" We take a look at a case study from Mokau in the Waitomo district to consider how coastal erosion is impacting property owners there .

item.title: The Top 5 Property Lawyers In NZ – Who You Need to Know | Ep. 487 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss who our top 5 property lawyers are in the country. These are the property lawyers who we know, like and trust ... and can hand on heart recommend.  The five lawyers are: Sue Foley from Landley Law Shelley Funnell from Henderson Reeves Katherine Mexted from Convex Legal Penny Liu from Liu Legal, and  Michelle Erasmus from The Conveyancing Shop Have a personal lawyer that you think we should add to the list, or who we should meet?

item.title: Should I Rent My Property To Friends & Family? The Honest Truth | Ep. 486 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether you should rent your property out to friends and family. Our feeling is that this is a big ... no. The reasons are: If you rent to family, you may undercharge rent and put yourself in a worse financial position If you are purchasing a property for a family member it may cause you to purchase a property that doesn't work as an investment property If you purchase a property for friends or family, you are restricted by location, which may mean that you buy in an area that doesn't make sense right now.

item.title: What Is The Exact Financial Point Where I Should Get Started In Property? | Ep. 485 | The Property Academy Podcast
How Do I Add An Extra Bedroom To a Property To Increase Its Yield? | Ep. 484 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the three ways you can add an extra bedroom to a property ... either to increase its rental yield, or to increase the value of the property itself. The three ways are: 1) dress a room differently with furniture, painting or recarpeting to point out that it could be used as a bedroom, 2) Add a partitioning wall to carve up large lounges and bedrooms into smaller rooms, or to repurpose an existing room, and 3) build an extra one on to the property itself.

item.title: Will I Have To Pay a Break Fee If I Sell My Property? ... The Cost Most Investors Miss | Ep. 483 | The Property Academy Podcast
How Do I Set Up A Successful Joint Venture Partnership To Invest With Others? | Ep. 482 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how to set up a successful joint venture partnership so that you can invest with other people. Investing with other people means that you can invest faster and benefit from the skills that others have. We detail the three things you can potentially bring to a partnership: time, skills or money (both income and equity) and a few ways that you can set up a JV both as a passive and as an active property investor.

item.title: Best of the Best: Top Performing Suburbs in 2020 – Highest Growth and Yields | Ep. 481 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the top performing suburbs within New Zealand for 2020. This is based on the Best of the Best report from Core Logic, which shows the suburbs that had the highest and lowest growth yields, as well as highest and lowest growth rates. Access the report here.  We reveal and summarise all of the data, including revealing the suburbs where properties took an average of just 7 days to sell in 2020.

item.title: 7 Things 'Uncle Lester' Will Say at the Family BBQ + Comebacks and Responses | Ep. 480 | The Property Academy Podcast
Should I Buy a Holiday Home? And Is It An Investment? | Ep. 479 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether you should buy a holiday home and what it means for your investment portfolio. We go through the numbers and how buying a holiday home impacts your Uncommitted Monthly Income.  the purpose of this exercise is not to tell you whether to buy a holiday home or not in your specific situation, but rather to help you understand the impact on the whole portfolio.

item.title: Top 10 Property Investment Books To Read Over the Summer Break | Ep. 478 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss our top 10 property investment books to read over the summer holidays to prepare for 2021. These are: Property 101, by Matt Gilligan Property Investments, by Martin Hawes Rich Kid, Smart Kid, by Robert Kiyosaki 20 Rental Properties in 1 Year, by Graeme Fowler Real Estate Riches – How to Become Rich By Using the Banks Money, by Dolf de Roos Jones on Property by Sir Bob (Robert) Jones Think and Grow Rich, by Napoleon Hill The Only Woman in the Room, compiled by Ashley Wilson How to Win Friends and Influence People, by Andrew Carnegie The Barefoot Investor, by Scott Pape What's on your summer reading list?

item.title: 21 Ideas For New Years Goals You Can Set Yourself For 2021 | Ep. 477 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss 21 different goals you could potentially set yourself in 2021. This includes everything from goals for first-time investors who want to learn the fundamentals of property investment, through to goals for experienced investors who are looking to spice up their portfolio.  We also go through Andrew's goal-setting framework, where he shares the three things you need if you are going to successfully set and complete your goals.

item.title: "I Grew Up Poor ... But I Did Not Have Poor Dreams" ... 7 People Who Inspired Us in 2020 | Ep. 476 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the 7 people who inspired us most in 2020. This includes people who listened to the show, turned up to our property investment events and shared their stories with us.  We also detail a few people who we had the pleasure to hear speak live who, although not property investors, inspired our financial ambitions all the same. These include John Travolta, Magic Johnson and Sir Michael Hill.

item.title: First Homes More Affordable Now Than In 2005 New Data Says | Ep 475 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss new data released as part of the Stuff housing affordability dashboard. Within this we show that although the median New Zealand sale price is $749,000 in November. The median sale price for first home buyers was $610,000 ... 19% less. We then track the number of weeks it takes to save a 10% deposit, and show that although it has increased by 33% from 84 to 112 weeks, if you include government and employer assistance, the number of weeks will have actually decreased over that time.

item.title: How Old Is Too Old? ... How To Expand Your Portfolio In Retirement | Ep. 474 | The Property Academy Podcast
The Exact 4 Step Process We Use To Find Investment Quality Developers + Development Projects | Ep. 473 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the exact 4 step process we use to find investment quality developers and development projects for investors. This includes using BCI to get information on upcoming development projects, through to getting introductions from the industry. We then discuss the sort of projects and developers we tart to look for, and what individual investors can and can't easily replicate. We also mention the new Property Academy Video Course.

item.title: Is It A Good Idea To Negotiate Early Access to Properties? ... Risks and Rewards | Ep. 472 | The Property Academy Podcast
What Is a Body Corporate ... And How Do They Work? | Ep. 471 | The Property Academy Podcast
All I Want For Christmas Is ... What We Hope Santa Slipped Under the Tree | Ep. 470 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss what we hope Santa has slipped under the tree for us both. Ed hopes that Santa will bring more houses to the market ... and more relaxed lending restrictions from the Reserve Bank ... along with support for the retail banks to lend more aggressively on new build investments. While, Andrew, on the other hand, hopes that Santa brings a cleaner property education and property coaching industry.

item.title: Ghost of Christmas Past ... Property Cycles + Did Our Previous Predictions Come True? | Ep. 469 | The Property Academy Podcast
Help! It's Xmas + I Can't Find a Tenant ... How To Get Through a Vacant Period | Ep. 468 | The Property Academy Podcast
New Data: There Aren't Enough Listings To Go Around ... Your Latest Market Update | Ep. 467 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we detail the latest data from the Real Estate Institute of New Zealand and realestate.co.nz. The main takeaway is that there aren't enough listings to go around.  Although the total number of listings was up over 14% compared to the last year ... the total number of properties was up almost 30%. That means that all around the country, there are a record low number of listings, which fuels house price growth.

item.title: Investors Require 40% Deposits With ANZ – What It Means + What Investors Need to Know | Ep. 466 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss ANZ's recent move to now require 40% deposits for investment properties. This is a major change in credit policy, that makes ANZ the most conservative bank when it comes to lending on investment properties. Here, we discuss the change, the exemptions, and how ANZ staff are implementing the new regime. We also go through the expected impact on house prices (not a lot), as well as how this fits in with what the bank's economists are reporting.

item.title: Core Concept: What Is Price Elasticity of Demand And Supply? | Ep. 465 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss price elasticity of demand and supply ... what they are ... and what they mean for property investors in New Zealand.  Price elasticity is a measure of how responsive quantity is to a change in price. The amount of a good that is purchased can either change a lot or a little in response to a change in price ... and understanding price elasticity helps us to predict how prices will change in the future.

item.title: How and When to Break Up With Your Mortgage Broker | Ep. 464 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the right and wrong way to break up with your mortgage broker, if you feel you aren't getting the advice that you want and need. If you do need to switch brokers, then don't just cut them off. Or opt for radio silence. Let them know you're moving on and that you appreciate the work they've already done for you. If you have a topic idea or a question, then send us a text.

item.title: The Economics of Being a Developer ... Do They Make a Lot of Money? | Ep. 463 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are once again joined by James Parker from Stonewood Canterbury to discuss the economics of being a developer, and the costs that are associated with building brand new residential properties in Canterbury. James shares that in a place like Selwyn District, 32% of the cost associated with a $550k property would go to land and then there would be an additional $2000 per square meter of build costs.

item.title: Bonus Webinar: Predictions and Forecasts for 2021 – How to Be Successful In the New Year | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description This is a special bonus piece of content, which is the audio from our recent webinar where Ed and Andrew discuss predictions and forecasts for the new year in property investment. Throughout the webinar we detail the 12 months of the year and what we forecast will happen in each month of the year. This includes Loan to Value Ratio restrictions, increased regulation, and lower and lower interest rates.

item.title: Is It Easy to Be a Developer? Top Challenges Facing Developers Right Now | Ep. 462 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by James Parker from Stonewood Canterbury to discuss the top problems residential property developers are currently facing ... and what they'll mean for you if you're trying to become a developer. These include labour shortages of skilled overseas workers; competition for building materials and scarcity of land pushing prices up even further. Got the next great topic idea? Or what about a guest we should have on the show?

item.title: Common Problems With New Builds ... A Developer's Perspective | Ep. 461 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by James Parker from Stonewood Canterbury to discuss the common problems that occur with new build investments.  Here James walks us through the process of how new build defects are picked up, and the most common ones he tends to spot. He then walks us through some of the biggest mistakes he's made while building new houses and what he's done to fix them.

item.title: How to Negotiate With a Developer ... Here's What They Really Care About | Ep. 460 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how to negotiate with a property developer ... and how to figure out what they really care about. We go over how a developer makes money ... and why the first properties that the pre-sell in a project will often be sold at a discount. We then transition to discuss the sort of developers that are more likely to negotiate with you ... and which ones won't.

item.title: Buy an Investment Property With a 10% Deposit? You Can If You Meet This Criteria | Ep. 459 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the BNZ's announcement that they are now willing to lend up to 90% for investors purchasing turn-key builds from a developer. This is effectively adding in the new build exemption which was always in place.  But, before you get too excited ... in order to get a loan with that little deposit, you'll need to be a "golden client" ... most likely double incomes in secure industries with clean credit and account conduct.

item.title: 5 Strategies If You Don't Have the Money to Invest Just Yet | Ep. 458 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the 5 strategies you can use if you don't have the money to invest in property just yet. This is based on an article that we recently released on the Opes Partners website.  The 5 strategies are: Pay off your mortgage more quickly Wait for capital growth Renovate your property Tap into the bank of Mum and Dad Save the rest Want to read the full article, you can find 5 Strategies If You Don't Have the Money to Invest here.

item.title: Big Cities v.s. Regions ... Which Get Better Capital Growth? The Data Speaks| Ep. 457 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this epiosde, we discuss whether cities or the smaller regions tend to get better capital growth over the long term. This is a contentious issue, with some claiming that cities get better capital growth ... and then other property commentators like Graeme Fowler refuting this claim.  Over the last 28 years, each of the regions has had a relatively similar amount of capital growth ... BUT the major cities are more consistent in that growth.

item.title: Should I Use Multiple Real Estate Agents to Sell My Property? | Ep. 456 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined for a final time by Slade Hocking, who is a buy and flip-focussed property investor, and a real estate agent. Here we discuss whether you should use multiple agents to sell your property so you can get the best price.  Generally speaking, our view is that using multiple agents incentivises not the best price ... but the quickest sale. That's because the agents are trying to beat one another to get a deal across the line, as opposed to the highest price.

item.title: Case Study: This Investor Made $600k+ From a Private Buy and Flip Deal | Ep. 455 | The Property Academy Podcast
Story Time: How This Buy + Flip Investor Got Their Start | Ep. 454 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by property investor and real estate agent, Slade Hocking, who specialises in renovation projects in the Canterbury market.  Here, Slade shares the story of how he became a property investor, and how he began to focus on both buy to flip, and buy to holds. We go through his family connections in property investment and how he manages being a property investor .

item.title: How Do I Get The Best Price For Your Property In A Crazy Market? | Ep. 453 | The Property Academy Podcast
Case Study: Which Mortgage Should I Pay Off First To Save Money? | Ep. 452 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss which mortgage you should pay off first if you want to save money on interest costs. This is based on a situation that was sent through from a listener of the show.  We discuss that you should always pay off your mortgage costs first, followed by investment debts if that is part of your strategy. However, it doesn't matter which investment mortgage you pay off first as long as the portfolio is structured together.

item.title: How to Save Money In Your Due Diligence By Structuring It The Right Way | Ep. 451 | The Property Academy Podcast
5 Reasons Why It's Not The Time To "Wait And See" | Ep. 450 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether now is the right time to wait and see how the market goes. We detail 5 reasons why it's not the time to put your hands in your pockets. One of the more compelling reasons is that regulations are increasingly becoming more stringent, limiting how easy it is to become a property investor. If it's easier to buy now, rather than later. It then makes sense to take action now.

item.title: How Have Australian House Prices Gone Under a Capital Gains Tax? | Ep. 449 | The Property Academy Podcast
NZ House Prices vs The World's .... Are We In Our Own Property Bubble? | Ep. 448 | The Property Academy Podcast
Debt to Income Ratios – What Do They Mean For NZ Investors? | Ep. 447 | The Property Academy Podcast

The Real Problem With Property Investment Coaches & The Property Industry | Ep. 445 | The Property Academy Podcast
What If I Can't Settle On My New Build Because The LVRs Changed? | Ep. 444 | The Property Academy Podcast
Practicalities of Getting a Flat Mate To Help You Pay Your Mortgage More Quickly | Ep. 443 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the practicalities of getting a flatmate to help you pay off your mortgage more quickly. This includes digging into tax and insurance concerns ... Should you tell your insurance company that you're going to get a flatmate? Do you need to pay tax on the income that you generate by having a flatmate? And what sort of agreements do you need to have in place.

item.title: Data Day: Average NZ House Sale Price Hits $725,000 ... +19.8% In One Year | Ep. 442 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the Real Estate Institute of New Zealand property report for October 2020. This report showed that the median sale price in NZ lifted 19.8% in the last 12 months, and that property prices, on the whole, were up 13.5% year on year.  We also discuss how other indicators of the property market are faring ... days to sell, inventory and new listing coming on the market .

item.title: Dear Governor ... The Minister of Finance Sends a Letter To the RBNZ Governor | Ep. 441 | The Property Academy Podcast
How To Fund Your OE Through Your Investment Properties ... How This Investor Did It | Ep. 440 | The Property Academy Podcast
What % of Properties Fail the Healthy Homes Act – An Honest Look At the Stats | Ep. 439 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the Healthy Homes Act and the percentage of properties that don't meet the standards. This is based on the property management book of Venture Management, our inhouse property management firm. We find that there are 6 key areas where properties are failing the new standards: draughts, insulation, heating, ventilation, drainage, and windows. Remember, if you have a topic that you'd like us to talk about on the show, send us a text on 5522.

item.title: Treasury vs The Reserve Bank ... What's the Difference & How Do They Impact House Prices? | Ep. 438 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the difference between the Treasury and the Reserve Bank ... and their respective impact on house prices.  The Treasury exists to advise the government on its fiscal policy (the money the government spends), while the Reserve Bank focusses on monetary policy, such as lending and bank regulation. All up, the Reserve Bank has more of an ability to impact house prices as compared to the Treasury.

item.title: Revealed: The Biggest Home Developers in NZ | Ep. 437 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss who the largest property developers in New Zealand are. This is based on the data released from BCI, a data firm, who focusses solely on the construction industry.  We go through the stats for each region to point out some key differences within each part of New Zealand. Finally, we wrap up by talking about the usefulness of the data and how you would practically use it in your investing strategy.

item.title: How To Renew Your Interest Only Loan ... And The Mistakes To Avoid | Ep. 436 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how to get the bank to renew your interest only loan. This is a critical topic, because sometimes your interest only period and your fixed interest period can get out of sync.  This becomes an issue for property investors who mid-way through a fixed interest period find themselves paying principal and interest, and not being able to get out of it without paying a break fee.

item.title: Mortgage Repayment Terms v.s. Documented Terms ... What Investors Need To Know | Ep. 435 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the difference between the term / timing that a bank will document a loan over to calculate minimum repayments and the actual term that you pay the mortgage back over.  This is important for investors to get their head around, because if you increase your repayments and allow the bank to shorten the documented term, then you will hurt your ability to get further lending for investment properties.

item.title: How Will Labour's 39% Top Tax Rate Impact Investor's Ability to Borrow From The Bank? | Ep. 434 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss Labour's new top tax rate of 39% and whether it will have an impact on property investor's ability to secure a mortgage.  Throughout the show, we run multiple models to figure out exactly how much less a high-earning property investor would be able to borrow from the bank. We end up agreeing that fro each $10k you earn over the threshold ($180k), you will be able to borrow about $8.

item.title: Breaking News: LVR Restriction Update – Larger Deposits Soon To Be Required | Ep. 433 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the LVR restrictions that are soon to be reintroduced by the Reserve Bank of New Zealand. These are expected to be reintroduced in March 2021, after the central bank finishes its consultation. It's generally expected that investors purchasing existing investment properties will require a 30% deposit. We also expect that investors purchasing brand new properties will be able to purchase with the existing 20% deposit.

item.title: New Format: Inside the RBNZ's Latest Monetary Policy Statement ... This One Is a Banger | Ep. 432 | The Property Academy Podcast
Active Investing Strategies – Will The Banks Ever Change the Amount They'll Lend Against A Property? | Ep. 431 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss a question from a listener of the show who runs active investment strategies. The bank would lend him 50% of the money for a project. But, after that project, he wants to know if they'll let him refinance above 50% of the properties new value.  We go on to detail some of the projects he's worked on over the last year, before wrapping up by mentioning the launch of our new coaching service.

item.title: Property Factory – An Honest Review Of Their Analysis and Properties | Ep. 430 | The Property Academy Podcast
Sir Bob Jones Predicts a Property Market Crash ... What Does He Mean? | Ep. 429 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss a few recent articles where Sir Bob Jones, New Zealand's most well-known billionaire, forecasts a property market crash. In the articles, he is quoted as saying that he has $250 million of cash ready to buy up property once prices begin to fall. We discuss that Sir Bob is a global commercial investor, and so his comments may not directly translate into the New Zealand residential property market.

item.title: How Long Do I Have To Take My Tenants to the Tenancy Tribunal? | Ep. 428 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we answer another question from a listener of the show ... this time, delving into how the tenancy tribunal works.  Typically, you have 60 days from the end of a tenancy to take your tenants to the tribunal. After that, you need to have a valid reason why it's been left past 60 days ... and you also need to have a servicing address for the tenants.

item.title: Help ... I Don't Have Enough Equity – Novel Strategies to Use Bank of Mum and Dad | Ep. 427 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss particularly novel strategies to tap into the Bank of Mum and Dad, with a focus on how to set these agreements up right. One of the novel strategies discussed is the idea of getting grandparents or parents to take out a reverse mortgage and then use it as the deposit for a property. We discuss the perceived pitfalls of this strategy and then detail a few alternatives that you might like to try before you go down that route.

item.title: Will The LVR Restrictions Be Brought Back In? | Ep. 426 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the removal of the LVR restrictions that occurred earlier this year and whether we believe the Reserve Bank will bring them back in during 2021. We also discuss the impact we believe new LVR restrictions would have, and come to the conclusion that they likely wouldn't slow house price growth. We also mention our new number, which you can text us on. If you have a topic suggestion or a question, feel free to text us on 5522 and we will message you back.

item.title: How To Negotiate Real Estate Agents' Fees | Ep. 425 | The Property Academy Podcast
"What Are The Top Things You Look For In An Investment Property ... Other Than The Things You Always Talk About?" | Ep. 424 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss a topic suggested by a listener of the show, who asks "what are the main things you look for in an investment property ... other than the usual things you talk about?" Andrew and Ed use a 23 step checklist when choosing investment properties for investors, so in this show, they both choose their top 3 ... but excluding the top factors they usually discuss on the show.

item.title: How to Negotiate a House Swap ... When & How to Do It | Ep. 423 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how to do a house swap and what to think about when you are going through this process. This episode topic comes from a listener of the show who has a specific situation that we discuss.  The main takeaway is to make sure that the deal makes sense in today's market at today's prices. Establish the value of both properties and then negotiate the price difference in terms of cash.

item.title: The Leaky Home Land Banking Strategy | Ep. 422 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by Kyle Brookland from Informed Property Inspections. Here, Kyle walks us through the Leaky Home Land Banking strategy and where he has seen investors purposely purchase leaky homes at cheap prices either for renovation or for land banking.  It's important to note that this is a high-risk and very sophisticated strategy, where the returns will be highly variable and in some cases, non-existant.

item.title: The Different Types of Cladding ... The Good, The Bad, And The Ugly | Ep. 421 | The Property Academy Podcast
The Main Problems Houses face Based on the Decade They Were Built In | Ep. 420 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by Kyle Brookland from Informed Property Inspections. Here, Kyle walks us through some of the key issues houses face based on the decade that they were built in. If you're looking at a house that was built prior to 1950, you'll want to check out the wiring ... that's what usually goes wrong. And if it's today's houses, then lookout for a leaking shower.

item.title: The Beginner's Guide to Building Inspections ... When's Best To Get One? | Ep. 419 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by Kyle Brookland from Informed Property Inspections. Here, Kyle walks us through the basics of property inspections, including how much they cost, what they include and whether the industry is regulated or not. We go through some of the common things to look for when shopping around for a building inspector and what you can expect to find within a building inspector's report.

item.title: Is It A Scam? ... Ed and Andrew Reveal Some of the Top Real Estate Scams in NZ | Ep. 418 | The Property Academy Podcast
Caught: Why These Real Estate Agencies Paid $4 Million+ to the Commerce Commission | Ep. 417 | The Property Academy Podcast
Case Study: How This First Home Buyer Got Their Foot On the Property Ladder While Earning Minimum Wage | Ep. 416 | The Property Academy Podcast
How Quickly Have Apartments Historically Grown In Value? The Numbers Revealed | Ep. 415 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we dig into the data to reveal how quickly apartments have grown in value over the last 20 and a half years. This is in response to some developers claiming – or intimating – that their apartments will increase in value at inflated figures.  Here, we reveal the figures across all the three major cities and also walk through some simple rules you can use to get a sense of what your apartment might grow at over the foreseeable future.

item.title: What Happens If Interest Rates Rise? ... A Worked Example | Ep. 414 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss a worked example about what happens if and when interest rates rise in the future.  This worked example figures out what the interest rate could rise to in order to make your property neutrally geared over a 10 year period. after 5 years. To do that you save the money while interest rates are low and then use those savings to pay for the higher interest rates if and when interest rates rise.

item.title: Who Are the Top 10 Mortgage Brokers In NZ? We Reveal Our Top 10 | Ep. 413 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we go through our list of the top 10 mortgage brokers in the country who we have had direct experience with. We also detail the reasons why we've chosen these specific brokers, along with who they might not be the right for.  These include Squirrel Mortgages, Lateral Partners, Tony Mounce Mortgages, Roost, New Zealand Home Loans, Loan Market, Jeff Elias, Maria Thackwell,  Vantage, and Eugene Bartsaiken.

item.title: 4 Real Life Tenancy Tribunal Cases From The Last Month + What They Mean | Ep. 412 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we walk you through 4 real-life case studies that have hit the tenancy tribunal recently, along with what you can learn from them as landlords.  The most interesting one for property investors was a case were the tenants were made to pay $1000 to the landlord for routinely tampering with smoke alarms. This charge was at a level that was seen to deter other tenants from continually messing with smoke alarms in the properties they rent.

item.title: How Do I Manage My Property Manager? | Ep. 411 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how to manage your property manager. Property managers naturally come with different levels of skill and experience. Some will be amazing, others not so much.  So you can't just take your hands off a long term buy and hold investment and leave it to your property manager. That's why we walk through a real-life inspection report and answer some common questions you might be thinking if you were to go through one yourself.

item.title: Live: How Will the Labour Government Impact the Property Market? | Ep. 410 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss a question that was asked by Katherine, a listener of our show at the live Auckland recording. Here, Katherine asked how the Labour Government will impact property investors in NZ.  Our key message is that property investors need to hang on. While there may be some changes that make property investment less profitable from a cashflow perspective, any new legislation is likely to be incremental only.

item.title: Live: Where and How to Invest $1 million In Today's Market | Ep. 409 | The Property Academy Podcast
Live: Going From An Owner-Occupier to An Investor | Ep. 408 | The Property Academy Podcast
Live in Auckland – Auckland Property Market Update In Front of A Live Studio Audience | Ep. 407 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we record the third-ever Property Academy Podcast episode recorded in front of a live studio audience. Here, we talk about the Auckland property market and how it is tracking right now. Andrew gives an on the ground perspective about what he's seeing from real estate agents, developers and vendors, while Ed digs into the data to show us whether Auckland is undervalued or overvalued. If you'd like to learn more about property, then check out the Epic Guide to Property Investment,  which teaches you the basics about how to invest in property.

item.title: Live in Wellington – Wellington Property Market Update In Front of A Live Studio Audience | Ep. 406 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we record the first-ever Property Academy Podcast episode recorded in front of a live studio audience. Here, we talk about the Wellington property market and how it is tracking right now. Andrew gives an on the ground perspective about what he's seeing from real estate agents, developers and vendors, while Ed digs into the data to show us whether Wellington is undervalued of overvalued. If you'd like to come along to an in-person Property Academy Podcast event, then there is one in Auckland as well on October 22nd.

item.title: Live in Christchurch – Property Market Update In Front of A Live Studio Audience | Ep. 405 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we record the first-ever Property Academy Podcast episode recorded in front of a live studio audience. Here, we talk about the Canterbury property market and how it is tracking right now.  Andrew gives an on the ground perspective about what he's seeing from real estate agents, developers and vendors, while Ed digs into the data to show us whether Canterbury is undervalued of over valued.

item.title: The #1 Risk of the Buy and Hold Investment Strategy ... & How to Avoid Being Unsuccessful | Ep. 404 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we detail the #1 risk that you face as an investor using the buy and hold investment strategy. It is not holding for long enough to get the capital growth and long term wealth that you were looking for when you first started investing.  We also detail several case studies of where investors have either had bad things happen to them throughout the strategy and also where they have been unsuccessful altogether.

item.title: One of Split Banking's Biggest benefits No Longer Exists ... So Should You Still Do It? | Ep. 403 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how one of split banking's greatest benefits – the ability to borrow more – no longer exists. This was caused by the removal of the LVR restrictions by the Reserve Bank at the start of the first Covid-19 lockdown.  So should you still do it? We suggest that you should, not just because of the other benefits of split banking, but also because the removal of the LVR limits are temporary.

item.title: Which Suburb Increased In Value By 19%+ in the 5 Months After The First Lockdown? | Ep. 402 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we detail the winners and losers, 5 months after the start of the first lockdown. This comes from a dataset of over 2800 suburbs from around the country, where the median change in value has been measured at March 24th and the 31st of August.   The biggest winner was Whanganui with a massive 19%+ increase in values in the 5 month period. And the biggest loser was Glendowie in Auckland, which dropped by 12%+ in value.

item.title: Term Deposits v.s. Property ... A Fair Comparison – And Why Term Deposit Holders Are Piling Into Property | Ep. 401 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we compare term deposits and property. Lower interest rates give a double boost to investment property. First, lower interest rates make investment property more profitable, since the interest on an investor's mortgage is usually the largest cost.  The second is that lower interest rates decrease the return on term deposits, making property relatively more profitable, again, compared to the alternative. Throughout this show, we go through a deep dive into the numbers and compare the decisions that real investors are facing in the current market.

item.title: How to Review Your Property Portfolio Each Year ... And Keep Track of Progress | Ep. 400 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are once again joined by Micky Limmer from Harcourts Canterbury. And here, we discuss strategies you can use to review your property portfolio each year.  The key message here is that you should review your portfolio each year, specifically looking for opportunities to increase your cashflow. That may be by increasing your rent or decreasing your operating expenses ... or it may be by reviewing interest rates and the structure of your mortgage.

item.title: The Seasons Of Property – The Ups and Downs That Repeat Each Year | Ep. 399 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined by Micky Limmer who is a real estate agent at Harcourts, Canterbury. Data shows that median house prices rise in Summer and fall in Winter. But, why is that? And what are the different seasons in the property market each year? Our consensus is that during the winter months, fewer homeowners at the top end of the market sell their properties, while the first home buyer market stays strong.

item.title: Let's Get Political! A Review of The Major Parties Housing Policies | Ep. 398 | The Property Academy Podcast
Does Population Growth = Capital Growth? Let the Data Speak! | Ep. 397 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether population growth leads to further increases in property prices. This is based on a recent article by Tony Alexander, an independent economist and friend of the show.  Our determination is that population growth is not a significant indicator of capital growth ... however, it is still not to be ignored because it is still ab important driver of a landlord's ability to secure a tenant, along with other related factors.

item.title: Auckland v.s. Wellington for Commercial Property – Sir Bob Jones Thoughts From My Property World | Ep. 396 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss the commercial property markets in both Auckland and Wellington from the eyes of Sir Bob Jones. This episode is based on Sir Bob's writings in his book My Property World, which is a follow up from his first property-based book ... Jones on Property.  Sir Bob sees Wellington as the more desirable city because of its lack of available land to build buildings on .

item.title: Facebook Group Price Fixing – The Commerce Commission Is Not Happy | Ep. 395 | The Property Academy Podcast
How to Use a Revolving Credit to Pay Off Your Home Mortgage Faster | Ep. 394 | The Property Academy Podcast
2 Investment Properties By the Age of 23 ... This Investor Reveals How She Did It | Ep. 393 | The Property Academy Podcast
Bonus Webinar: Pilfered or Protected – How to Protect and Save Money On Your Investment Properties | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description This is a special bonus piece of content, which is the audio from our recent webinar where property accountant, Matthew Harris showed us how to save money on your investment properties by paying the correct amount of tax. From Matt's point of view, many Kiwi property investors pay more tax than they otherwise would need to. This is because they haven't structured their affairs in the most efficient and opportune way.

item.title: Is It Really Harder To Buy Your First Home Today? 26-yr Old Property Investor Weighs In | Ep. 392 | The Property Academy Podcast
How To Keep The Bank Lending You Money ... And Some Hard Truths | Ep. 391 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss things you can do to keep the bank lending you money. This is also given in the context of the situation many of our podcast listeners face, where they have a decent amount of equity, but get tapped out on servicing.  We go through the standard tricks, such as adapting credit card limits and restructuring existing loans, but also walk you through the fact that you are likely to get tapped at some point.

item.title: Helping and Getting Help From Others .... How To Do It The Right Way | Ep. 390 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we talk about how to help others when you are a property investor ... and how to get help. This includes how to talk to your parents about tapping into the Bank of Mum and Dad. We also discuss the reverse – how to help your your parents as they approach retirement.  This stems from a discussion where an investor we worked with at Opes Partners was likely to get an inheritance and be sorted for retirement.

item.title: 10 Conditional Clauses You Need to Know About ... & Which Ones To Use | Ep. 389 | The Property Academy Podcast
How to Buy The House You Just Drove Passed ... A Step By Step Guide | Ep. 388 | The Property Academy Podcast
Should I Furnish My Investment Property? The Costs You'll Face and Rent You'll Get | Ep. 387 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether it is profitable to furnish your investment property. We go through the numbers, the costs and the additional rent you are likely to receive.  For a 2 bedroom unit or apartment, you are likely to receive an additional $50 a week in rent ($2,600 a year), and it is likely that it will cost $10,000 to furnish that property. All up we include that this style of furnishing is generally not worth it based on these numbers.

item.title: How to Succeed in an Auction ... What Property Investors Need to Know | Ep. 386 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss how to win at an auction. We also delve into what you need to know in order to prepare yourself, both financially and emotionally, for the auction.  It's important to note that auctions are unconditional and that if you bid and are the winner you are now bound as the purchaser. That means that you need to have conducted all your due diligence before you begin to bid.

item.title: Reverse Mortgages ... How to Lose $1 mil in 30 Years | Ep. 385 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss reverse mortgages. Reverse mortgages are a financial product where older New Zealanders are able to borrow against their home without making repayments to the bank.  Here, we talk through the benefits and the drawbacks of these sorts of loans, including their high-interest rates and the speed at which they can erode the equity you've built up in your home. We also talk through the alternatives that you have if you are nearing retirement to ensure you can access funds without eroding your financial position.

item.title: Councils Forced To Approve Consents For More Houses With No Carparks | Ep. 384 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss new urban planning rules that come into effect in February 2022. This will force councils to approve some developments that don't have car parks. We discuss the likely outcome, which is that properties with car parks will become relatively more valuable and experience some capital gain as a result. That's because not all of the cost savings will be passed on to the initial purchaser of the property.

item.title: Mortgagee Sales – Investment Gold Mine .... or Investment Land Mine? | Ep. 383 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss whether mortgagee sales are a good way to make money for New Zealand property investors.  Our takeaway is that while mortgagee sales can be a good way to make money, you need to be aware of what it takes to be successful. You have to be willing to undertake a very active strategy and take on certain risks of damage from existing occupants.

item.title: Treasury Predicts House Prices Will Rise 24.5% ... So Why Does the Reserve Bank Say They'll Halve? | Ep. 382 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we discuss recent data released by the NZ Treasury as part of the Pre Election Fiscal Update. Within this report, analysts forecast that house prices will increase 24.5% over the next 5 years.  However, on Thursday 17th September, Stuff published an article suggesting that the Reserve Bank predict house prices to halve. We discuss the issues with this article and show why the Reserve Bank's position was misrepresented.

item.title: How Real Investors Are Responding to the Healthy Homes Act | Ep. 381 | The Property Academy Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In this episode, we are joined for the final time by Linda Forsyth from Venture Property Management. Here, Linda walks us through how the property investors she looks after are responding to the Healthy Homes Act. One quirk around the act is that older, draughtier homes can sometimes have an easier time meeting heating standard, compared to newer, drier homes. The reason for this is that a heatpump is required for the living area.

item.title: Property Manager Reveals The Funniest Stories From 20 Years Managing Properties | Ep. 380 | The Property Academy Podcast
